title: Create action
name: CreateAction
description:
Create an action. An action specifies a package to deploy, the machines to target, and the deploy schedule.

For general information on actions, refer to the Tanium actions overview in the Tanium Core Platform User Guide at: https://docs.tanium.com/platform_user/platform_user/actions_overview.html

Body parameters.description: (Required) The action object to create. The package_spec object is a required field.

Error 4xx.description: The input JSON must contain the package_spec object.
The package_spec object in the input JSON must contain the id field or the name field.

examples.title: Example 400 response

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create action group
name: CreateActionGroup
description: Create an action group. Use action groups to target actions so that they are issued to only appropriate computer groups.

Body parameters.description: (Optional) The action_group object to create. No fields are required.

Error 4xx.description: The input JSON must not contain the id field.
Another action group with the same name already exists. Select a different name or delete the existing action group with the same name.
The input JSON must contain the name field.

examples.title: Example request

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create action stop
name: CreateActionStop
description: Create an action_stop object to stop a specified action (identified by ID).

Body parameters.description: (Required) The action_stop object to create. The action field is required.

Error 4xx.description: The action_stop object in the input JSON must include the action object.
The id field of the action object in the input JSON must contain a valid value.

examples.title: Example request

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create saved action
name: CreateSavedAction
description: Create a saved (scheduled) action that can reissue an action multiple times. The saved action creates a new action object when it issues an action.

Body parameters.description: (Required) The saved_action object to create. The package, action_group, and expire_seconds fields are required for the saved_action object.

Error 4xx.description: The saved_action object in the input JSON must include the action_group object.
The saved_action object in the input JSON must include the package_spec object.
The id field of the package_spec object in the input JSON must reference a valid object.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Delete action group
name: DeleteActionGroup
description: Delete the action group that matches the specified ID. Deleting an action group sets the deleted_flag field to 1, but does not remove the object from the server.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the action_group object to delete.

Success 200.description: The deleted action_group object. The deleted_flag field is set to 1.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Delete saved action
name: DeleteSavedAction
description: Delete the saved action that matches the specified ID. The saved_action object is removed from the server and is no longer available.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the saved_action object to delete.

Error 4xx.description: No saved_action object matches the specified ID.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Get action by ID
name: GetActionByID
description: Retrieve the action that matches the specified ID.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the action object to retrieve.

Error 4xx.description: No action object matches the specified ID.

title: Get action groups
name: GetActionGroups
description: Retrieve all action group definitions on the server.

Success 200.description: The action_group_list object contains an array of all action_group objects on the server. If there are no action_group objects, returns an empty array.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Get action result info by ID
name: GetActionResultInfoByID
description: Retrieve the result information for the action that matches the specified ID.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the action object for which to retrieve results.

Success 200.description: The ResultXML object that matches the question ID.

Error 4xx.description: No action object matches the specified ID.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

Error 4xx.description: No action_stop object matches the specified ID.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Get actions
name: GetActions
description: Retrieve all action definitions on the server.

Success 200.description: The action_list object contains an array of all action objects on the server. If there are no action objects, the action_list only contains the cache_info.

title: Get saved actions
name: GetSavedActions
description: Retrieve all saved action definitions on the server.

Success 200.description: The saved_action_list object contains an array of all saved_action objects on the server. If there are no saved_action objects, the saved_action_list only contains the cache_info.

         "creation_time" : "2018-08-13T18:02:33Z",
         "distribute_seconds" : 0,

            "available_time" : "2018-08-13T18:02:53Z",
            "command" : "cmd /c cscript //T:1200 clean-stale-tanium-client-data.vbs /StaleDownloadsRestart:True /MaxClientRAMInMB:200",

The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Update action by ID
name: UpdateActionByID
description: Update the action that matches the specified ID.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the action to update.

Body parameters.description: An action object that contains the fields to update. Fields not included in the JSON are not updated. Any fields that you specify overwrite existing fields.

Error 4xx.description: No action object matches the specified ID.

title: Update action group by ID
name: UpdateActionGroupByID
description: Update the action group that matches the specified ID. When you update an action group, the server creates a new action_group object using the fields from the original action group and the fields supplied in the input JSON. The server then sets the deleted_flag field on the original action_group object to 1.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the action_group object to update.

Body parameters.description: An action_group object that contains the fields to update. Fields not included in the JSON are not updated. Any fields that you specify overwrite existing fields.

Error 4xx.description: No action_group object matches the specified ID.
The name field must contain a value.

title: Get audit logs
name: GetAuditLogs
description:
Retrieve the audit log entries for a specified object. You can include optional start and end times to limit the audit entries. Objects with audit logs include:

  • api_token
  • content_set
  • content_set_role
  • dashboard
  • dashboard_group
  • group
  • package_spec
  • plugin_schedule
  • saved_action
  • saved_question
  • sensor
  • system_setting
  • user
  • user_group
  • white_listed_url

Tip: Use the Get audit types route to get an updated list of objects that you can audit on the server.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The type of object for which to retrieve the audit log. Use the plural form of the object name.
(Required) The ID of the object for which to retrieve the audit log.

Query string parameters.description: (Optional) A start date and time to filter the data. Use the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
(Optional) An end date and time to filter the data. Use the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

Success 200.description: The audit_log_list contains an array of matching audit_log objects.

Error 4xx.description: The specified type does not exist. Verify the syntax of the type and ensure the name is plural. For example, use "sensors" instead of "sensor".
The specified type does not exist. Verify the syntax of the type and ensure the name is plural. For example, use "packages" instead of "package".

The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Get audit types
name: GetAuditTypes
description: Retrieve the list of audit types on the server.

Success 200.description: The list of audit types on the server in a JSON format. Each audit type contains a column field and name field.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create API token
name: CreateAPIToken
description:
Create an api_token object that you can use for authentication across multiple sessions.

  • As with all API requests, you must have a valid session string or an existing token string to create a token.
  • The Tanium server only authenticates tokens from the module server in addition to any clients from IP addresses listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.
  • To use tokens, users must be assigned the Administrator role or have the Use Token permission.
  • By default, an api_token is valid for seven days. To change the expiration timeframe, edit the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting or include a value with the expire_in_days field when you create the token.
  • If the server restarts, all api_token objects are deleted, but the tokens remains valid until they expire in the database.

Body parameters.description: (Required) An empty data set. Can also be passed on the header as --data "{ }" or --data null.

Success 200.description: The new api_token object. Use the token_string value (including the token- prefix) instead of a session string as authentication for additional API routes.

Error 4xx.description: Verify the syntax of the request and that the server is running and reachable from the client.
If authenticating with tokens, verify the token string is valid and that the IP of the client is listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.

examples.title: Example request (with fields)
examples.content:
$ curl -s -X POST -H "session:{string}" --data-binary @new_token.json https://localhost/api/v2/api_tokens
    # where new_token.json contains the following:
    # {
    #    "expire_in_days" : 30,
    #    "name" : "module_token",
    #    "notes" : "My module token that expires in 30 days."
    # }

examples.title: Example response (with fields)

The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

If authenticating with tokens, verify the token string is valid and that the IP of the client is listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.

title: Log in
name: LogIn
description: Log in to the Tanium Server. On success, the server responds with a session string that is valid for five minutes. Additional requests to the server require the session string. Each request to the server resets the timeout of the session string back to five minutes. Use the Validate route to check if the session string is still valid.

Body parameters.description: (Optional) An auth object that contains the login information.

Success 200.description: The session string. Use this string as input for the remaining API routes.

Error 4xx.description: Verify the syntax of the request and that the server is running and reachable from the client.

examples.title: Example request
examples.content:
$ curl -s -X POST --data-binary @sample_login.json https://localhost/api/v2/session/login
    # where sample_login.json contains the following:
    # {
    #    "username" : "jane.doe",
    #    "domain" : "dev",
    #    "password": "JanesPassword"
    # }

title: Log out
name: LogOut
description: Log out of the Tanium Server. Use this route to end a session.

Body parameters.description: The session string.

Error 4xx.description: The session string is not valid. The session may already have ended.

title: Create filter-based group
name: CreateFilterBasedGroup
description: Create a filter-based computer group. This route accepts canonical text in the text field. If you do not know the exact text of the question to base the group on, use the Parse question route to retrieve a list of question objects with possible canonical questions. There are two types of computer groups: manual groups and filter-based groups. For more information , see https://docs.tanium.com/platform_user/platform_user/console_computer_groups.html.

Body parameters.description:
(Required) The group object to create. The name field is normally required. If you have one of the following privileges, you can exclude the name field to create an anonymous group:

  • administrator
  • content administrator
  • write computer group
  • define question
  • write action
  • Both:
    • write action for saved question
    • read saved question

Error 4xx.description: Another computer group with the same name already exists. Select a different name or delete the existing computer group with the same name.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Update computer group name by ID
name: UpdateComputerGroupNameByID
description: Update the name of the computer group that matches the specified ID. Use this route to update the name of a filter-based computer group or a manual group. Only the name field is editable; any other fields that you include in the input JSON is ignored. If you need to edit any other fields, you can delete the computer group and create a new computer group with the same name.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the computer group to update.

Body parameters.description: A group object that contains the name field to update.

Error 4xx.description: No group object matches the specified ID.
The input JSON must not include the ID field. The ID is already included as a query parameter.

title: Create content set
name: CreateContentSet
description: Create a content set. A content set is a group of sensors, saved questions, dashboards, categories, and packages to which a permission applies. A content set is required for every sensor, package, saved question, dashboard, and dashboard group.

Body parameters.description: The content_set object to create. The name field is required.

Error 4xx.description: The input JSON must contain the name field.
The name of the content set must be unique. An existing content_set object already contains the same name.

examples.title: Example request

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create content set privilege
name: CreateContentSetPrivilege
description: Create a privilege. Privileges are used by roles to assign or deny permissions to users and user groups.

Body parameters.description: (Required) The content_set_privilege object to create. The name field is required.

Error 4xx.description: The input JSON must contain the name field.
The name of the privilege must be unique. An existing content_set_privilege object already contains the same name.

examples.title: Example request
examples.content:
$ curl -s -X POST --data-binary @new_content_set_privilege.json -H "session:{string}" https://localhost/api/v2/content_set_privileges
    # where new_content_set_privilege.json contains the following:
    # {
    #    "name" : "Sample Content Set Privilege",
    #    "privilege_module" : "mymodule",
    #    "privilege_type" : "module",
    #    "reserved_name" : "show something"
    # }

title: Export
name: ExportObject
description:
Export objects by the name of the objects. Any related objects are included in the export. Objects export to a JSON format that you can save to a file. Valid objects to export include:

  • content_set
  • content_set_privilege
  • content_set_role
  • content_set_role_privilege
  • dashboard
  • dashboard_group
  • ldap_sync_connector
  • package_spec
  • saved_action
  • saved_question
  • sensor
  • white_listed_url

Body parameters.description: The JSON specifying the object type and object names to export. Use the format { "objects" : { "include" : [ "name1", "name2" ] } }. Alternatively, you can include all objects of a type using a "include_all" field set to true.

Success 200.description: The exported objects in a JSON format.

Error 4xx.description: No object found that matches the specified name. This error is returned if any of the objects specified in the input JSON does not exist.
The format of the input JSON is not valid.

title: Get import status by ID
name: GetImportStatus
description: Retrieve the status of an asynchronous import job.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the asynchronous import job to retrieve.

Success 200.description:
A JSON object containing the status information for the import job. Possible fields include:

  • end_time - The time when the import completed. Only included after the import completes.
  • exception - If the import failed (success is false), this field contains the error message.
  • id - The ID of the import job.
  • result - Contains a string with conflict details. Only included after the import completes.
  • start_time - The time when the import started.
  • status_text - Displays the current operation. Only included if the import is not complete.
  • success - Value is true if the import completed successfully, false if the import failed. Only included after the import completes.

Error 4xx.description: No import job matches the specified ID.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Import
name: ImportObject
description:
Import objects from a JSON file. Before import, the file must be signed. For more information, see Signing content XML files in the Tanium™ Core Platform User Guide.

Valid objects to import include:

  • content_set
  • content_set_privilege
  • content_set_role
  • content_set_role_privilege
  • dashboard
  • dashboard_group
  • ldap_sync_connector
  • package_spec
  • plugin
  • saved_action
  • saved_question
  • sensor
  • solution
  • white_listed_url

Note: If multiple saved_action objects with the same name are included in a single import, the server creates a separate saved_action object for each saved_action. Any saved_action objects with duplicate names already on the server are deleted.

If you post a deprecated XML solution file to /api/v2/import, the server upgrades the file and imports the file. If you want to import a deprecated file without upgrading the file to the current version, use the /api/v2/import/upgrade route to post the file; the server response is a JSON export file.

Header parameters.description: (Optional) Include if you want the import request to respond asyncronously.

(Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

Body parameters.description: (Optional) Specify how to handle import conflicts. You can specify a value for each object in the object_list. Values are handled in the order that the objects appear in the object_list. For possible values, see import_conflict_options.
A list of objects to import, in a JSON format. Use KeyUtility.exe to sign the JSON file before you import the file.
The import version.

Query string parameters.description: (Optional) Set to 1 if you want the import to only preview conflicts.

(Optional) Specify a value to use if you do not specify any import_conflict_options. If there are fewer options in the import_conflict_options than objects in the object_list, any option that you specify for default_import_conflict_option applies to the extra objects. For a list of possible values, see import_conflict_options.

Error 4xx.description: A signature is required to import the file.
Set the version field to 2, and make sure the input JSON format is valid.

title: api_token
description:
An authentication token that a user account can use across multiple sessions.

There are several global settings that affect api_token objects. You can edit these settings through the Update system setting by name route:

  • The api_token_expiration_in_days setting controls how long a token is valid before it expires. Default is seven days.
  • The api_token_trusted_ip_address_list setting controls the list of client IP addresses from which the Tanium server authenticates tokens. This list does not need to include the IP address of the Module server, because the Tanium Server always authenticates tokens from the Module server.
  • The api_token_string_length setting controls the length of the token string.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
created_timestringRead-onlyThe UTC time and date when the object was created.
deleted_flagintRead-onlyValue is true if the api_token is deleted, false if the api_token is active.

Allowed values:0,1

expirationstringRead-onlyThe UTC time and date when this token expires.
expire_in_daysintOptionalThe number of days before the token expires. You can set this value when you create the token to ignore the default expiration set by the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting. If this field is not set and the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting does not exist, the token expires after seven days. Valid values include integers greater than 0.
idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the api_token object.
last_used_onstringRead-onlyThe UTC time and date when this token was last used to authenticate to the server.
namestringOptionalThe name of the object.
notesstringOptionalUse this field to add any comments for the token.
token_stringstringRead-onlyThe token string to use to authenticate to the user.
useruserRead-onlyThe user account that was used to create the api_token.

Used by:

ObjectField
api_token_listapi_token
name: NoneApi_token

title: cache_filter
description:
Specify a field for which to filter cache results. The filter field can also be a path to a particular element in the response XML, such as queries/query/platform.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
and_flagintOptionalOnly used when the sub_filters field contains a value. Set to 0 to require only one sub_filter to match (OR). Set to 1 to required all sub_filters to match (AND).

Allowed values:0,1

fieldstringOptionalOnly return matches for this field.
not_flagintOptionalIf set to 1, the server only returns rows returned that do not match this filter. Default is 0.

Allowed values:0,1

operatorstringOptionalDefines how the values of the items being tested are compared against the value specified in the filter. Available operators are:
  • RegexMatch: the item passes if its value matches the regular expression specified in the filter value
  • Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal: the item passes if its value is Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal to the filter value
The default is equal.
sub_filterscache_filter_listOptionalSupported for ResultData only. If specified, all other fields except not_flag and and_flag, are ignored.
typestringOptional 
valuestringOptionalHow the values are compared. Valid values include:
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are expected to be version strings, such as 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • IPAddress: values are expected to be IP addresses
  • Date: a date in the format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
  • DataSize: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • NumericInteger: values are expected to be integer numeric values

Used by:

ObjectField

title: filter
description:
Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
aggregationstringOptionalNot used.
all_times_flagintOptionalNot used.
all_values_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, a plural item passes the filter only if all of its values pass the filters. By default, a plural item passes if any of its values passes.

Allowed values:0,1

delimiterstringOptionalA single-character delimiter. If delimiter is not empty, then the item value is expected to be a list of values separated by the delimiter and the actual value tested is the item whose index is specified in the delimiter_index. Use this field with the sensor "sub columns" feature.
delimiter_indexintOptionalThe index of the item to test against. Used in conjunction with the delimiter field.
end_timestringOptionalNot used.
idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the filter object.
ignore_case_flagintOptionalUnlike most flags, this defaults to 1 which means case is ignored by default.

Allowed values:0,1

max_age_secondsintOptionalHow old a sensor result can be before it is no longer considered valid. Default is 0, which means to use the max_age property of the sensor.
not_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, negate the match.

Allowed values:0,1

operatorstringOptionalDefines how the values of the items being tested are compared against the value specified in the filter. Available operators are:
  • HashMatch: the item passes if the hash of its value matches the filter value (this is the default)
  • RegexMatch: the item passes if its value matches the regular expression specified in the filter value
  • Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal: the item passes if its value is Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal to the filter value.
sensorsensorOptionalWhen a filter is applied to clients, the values of this sensor are tested.
start_timestringOptionalNot used.
substring_flagintOptionalIf 1, the substring of the item's value specified by substring_start and substring_length is tested instead of the item's value itself.

Allowed values:0,1

substring_lengthintOptionalThe length of the string in the value to compare. Used in conjunction with the substring_start.
substring_startintOptionalThe index in the value to begin the string comparison. Used in conjunction with the substring_length.
utf8_flagintOptionalNot used.
valuestringOptionalDepending on the operator, this is the regular expression to match, the hash to match, or the value to compare against.
value_typestringOptionalSpecifies how the values are compared. This does not apply if the operator is HashMatch or RegexMatch. The default is the result type of the sensor.
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are expected to be version strings, for example 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • BESDate: values are expected to be valid BES date strings
  • IPAddress: values are expected to be IP addresses
  • WMIDate: values are expected to be valid WMI date strings
  • TimeDiff: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of time, such as "2 years, 3 months, 18 days, 4 hours, 22 minutes, and 3.67 seconds" or "4.2 hours" (numeric + "Y|MO|W|D|H|M|S" units)
  • DataSize: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • NumericInteger: values are expected to be integer numeric values

Used by:

ObjectField
filter_listfilter
selectfilter

examples.title: Example
examples.content:
{
   "aggregation" : "Sum",
   "all_times_flag" : false,
   "all_values_flag" : false,
   "delimiter" : "",
   "delimiter_index" : 0,
   "ignore_case_flag" : true,
   "max_age_seconds" : 0,
   "not_flag" : true,
   "operator" : "RegexMatch",
   "sensor" : {
      "hash" : 3409330187
   },
   "substring_flag" : false,
   "substring_length" : 0,
   "substring_start" : 0,
   "utf8_flag" : false,
   "value" : ".*",
   "value_type" : "String"
}

value_hashintRead-onlyThe hash that identifies the string value that was generated by the sensor.

title: ldap_sync_connector
description:
Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
base_groupsstringOptional 
base_usersstringOptionalThe base DN for users. For example, cn=Users,dc=tam,dc=local. Tanium Appliance Note: If the Tanium Server is an Appliance (Linux), the Base User or the Base Group values cannot be the root of a domain.
disable_ldap_authintOptional 
disable_referrals_flagintOptionalSet to 0 to allow referrals, set to 1 to disable referrals. Referrals must be disabled if the LDAP server is a Microsoft Active Directory server.
enableintOptionalSet to 0 to disable the connector, set to 1 to enable the connector. If the configuration is enabled, synchronization occurs every 5 minutes. If the configuration is disabled, the users and user groups that were previously imported are deleted at the next sync time (within 5 minutes). If the configuration is subsequently re-enabled, the users and user groups are re-added, with the same object ID that they were initially assigned.
filter_groupsstringOptionalThe filter for user groups. For example, objectClass=group. You can use the backslash (\) to escape special characters in a group name. For Windows, use one backslash (example: name=\#myGroup). For the Appliance (Linux), use two backslashes (example: name=\\#myGroup).
filter_usersstringOptionalThe filter for user names. For example, objectClass=user. If you create an LDAP sync connector for the Tanium Server local authentication service, you must use the following user filter: (&(objectClass=person)(uidNumber>=20000))
group_idstringOptional 
group_memberstringOptional 
group_namestringOptionalA case sensitive group name. Example: cn
hoststringOptionalFully-qualified domain name (FQDN) or IP address for the LDAP server.
idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the ldap_sync_connector object.
last_sync_resultstringRead-only 
last_sync_timestampstringRead-only 
ldap_passwordstringOptional 
ldap_userstringOptional 
members_only_flagintOptional 

Allowed values:0,1

namestringOptionalThe unique name of the LDAP synchronization connector.
portintOptionalThe port that the LDAP connector listens on for inbound traffic. The standard port for LDAP is 389, and the standard port for LDAPS/SSL is 636.
secureintOptional 
user_display_namestringOptional 
user_domainstringOptional 
user_idstringOptionalA unique, case sensitive, ID. Example: objectGUID
user_member_ofstringOptional 
user_namestringOptionalIf you do not use NTLM, specify an LDAP server user name. The account should have privileges that are sufficient to query the LDAP server but otherwise be an account with low privileges.
use_ntlmintOptionalSet to 1 to use NTLM for the connection with the LDAP server, set to 0 if you do not want to use NTLM. Default is 1. Recommended when the Tanium Server is installed on a Windows Server and the connection is to an Active Directory server. If you use NTLM, the Tanium Server service account is used, and you do not need to configure a user name and password. The LDAP server must allow this account to query with the filter expression(s) configured for the LDAP sync connector.

Used by:

ObjectField

title: options
description:
Available options that you can include as body parameters or query string parameters on requests to the server.

Query string parameters

OptionTypeDescription
aggregate_by_value_flagintFor single-select questions with force_computer_id_flag=1. If set to 1, result data is presented as one string hash per row with count.
aggregate_over_time_flagint 
allow_cdata_base64_encode_flagintWhen set to 1, and there is invalid XML character in the result data, the server base64 encodes the CDATA tag. When data is encoded, a read-only option "cdata_base64_encoded" is added as an indicator.
audit_history_sizeintUse with objects such as audit_log with the type and object ID specified, to limit the number of entries returned.
cache_expirationintThe number of seconds (600 max) the cache remains in memory on the server. Each request renews the specified cache. Setting cache_expiration to 0 expires the cache.
cache_filterscache_filter_listA list of cache_filter objects that filter the results that are returned. For multiple filters, an item must pass all filters to be returned.
cache_idlongUse cache_id in subsequent requests to use this cache for performance gains. Requests that support a cache respond with the cache_info populated.
cache_sort_fieldsstringUse to sort the objects in a particular cache. Only sorting of top level tags of objects is supported. This is a comma delimited list with a "-"" in front of the field name for reverse sort.
cdata_base64_encodedintSee allow_base64_encode_flag for details.
context_idintUse with the Get question result info by ID route to specify the group_id of the issued questions, because saved questions can be issued with different group IDs in different contexts.
disable_live_snapshotsint 
export_dont_include_relatedintSet to 1 if you want the export to not include related objects.
export_flagintSet to 1 to export all data to a file in the Tanium Server\http\export folder with name <timestamp>.cvs. The related <timestamp>.status and <timestamp>.qid files are created in the same directory for progress tracking and debugging.

Allowed values:0,1

export_formatintValid values:
  • 0 = CSV format (backward compatible with console export)
  • 1 = result xml format, similar to normal api use
  • 2 = CEF format, flattened
export_hide_csv_header_flagintWhen exporting in CSV format, omit column headers.
export_leading_textstringWhen exporting, insert this text to the beginning of each line.
export_trailing_textstringWhen exporting, append this text to the end of each line.
filter_not_flagintIf set to 1, the rows returned are all the rows that do not match the value in the filter_string field.
filter_stringstringFilter results to only include items that match this regular expression. This field is independent of any filters in cache_filters.
flagsint 
hide_errors_flagint 
hide_no_results_flagint 
import_analyze_conflicts_onlyintSet to 1 if you want the import to only preview conflicts.
import_conflict_optionsimport_conflict_optionsSpecify how to handle import conflicts.
import_existing_ignore_content_setintSet to 1 if imported objects should stay in their current content set if they already exist.
include_answer_times_flagint 
include_hashes_flagint 
include_hidden_flagintWhen retrieving objects, set to 1 to include hidden objects (objects with hidden_flag = 1). Types of objects that can be hidden include actions, packages, questions, sensors, and system_settings.
include_user_detailsintUse for get user requests. Set to 1 to return additional user object (for each requested user) with additional details, such as active_session_count.
include_user_owned_object_ids_flagintReturn owned object IDs. Administrator only.
json_pretty_printintUse readable format for exported JSON objects.
live_snapshot_always_use_secondsint 
live_snapshot_expiration_secondsint 
live_snapshot_invalidate_report_count_percentageint 
live_snapshot_report_count_thresholdint 
most_recent_flagintSet to 1 to include the most recent results for all endpoints, including the most recent results for offline endpoints.
no_result_row_collation_flagintIf set to 1, identical result rows do not stack. Set to 1 to get one row per computer with CID.
pct_done_limitint 
recent_result_bucketsstringA comma-separated list of integers. If empty or unspecified, the default value is "600,3600,86400,604800". When the most_recent_flag field is set to 1, results that are identical other than age are grouped into age range buckets. By default, all ages less than 600 seconds are in the first ("current results") group. The second group contains all ages less than 3600 seconds, but greater than or equal to 600. The final group includes all ages greater than the last specified range. You may include any number of buckets.
return_cdata_flagintSet to 1 to return results in the ResultXML tag as raw xml wrapped in a CDATA tag instead of the result_object tag.
return_lists_flagintSet to 1 to consolidate result objects into a list tag, enabling the inclusion of "info" tag metadata.
row_countintSpecify a row_start and row_count to select a subset of the result data.
row_counts_only_flagint 
row_startintSpecify a row_start and row_count to select a subset of the result data.
sample_countintThe number of samples to examine.
sample_frequencyintThe duration between samples, in seconds.
sample_startintThe number of samples into the past to start with. For example set to 0 to start with the most recent sample.
saved_question_qids_allow_multiple_flagsintUse to find all question IDs (instead of the recent one) for a given saved question ID.
saved_question_qids_ignore_mr_group_flagintAdministrator only. Use to find all question IDs for a given saved question ID.
saved_question_qids_include_expired_flagint 
saved_question_qids_reissue_flagintSet to 1 to reissue the specified saved question using the group ID specified in the context_id field.
script_datastringUse to pass data between plugins.
sort_orderstringSpecify the sort order as a comma-separated list of column indices, where the first column is column 1. A negative number indicates descending sort order. For example, "3,-2" means sort by the third column ascending first, and break ties by sorting by the second column descending.
suppress_scriptsint 
suppress_object_listintSet to 1 if you do not want the original object returned on add and update routes. Default value is 0.
use_error_objectsintOn a failed request, display the error details for a specific object instead of just an exception message.
use_jsonintReturn objects in JSON format.
use_user_context_flagint

  • CACHED

Allowed values:0,1

namestringOptionalThe unique name of the package_file object.
sizeintOptional 
sourcestringOptionalWhere to get the file from, usually a URL or UNC path.
statusintRead-onlyThe download status of the file. Common values are:
  • 0 - check cache_status
  • 2 - in progress
  • 4 - in progress
  • Other number less than 100 - error
  • 200 - complete (check cache_status)
  • 4xx - HTTP client error
  • 5xx - HTTP server error
  • 1xxx - other error
trigger_downloadintOptionalWhen set to 1, use this field with the Update by ID route to trigger a re-download of this file into the cache.

title: package_spec
description:
A package_spec object defines a package. A package contains a list of files to distribute and a command to run.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
available_timestringRead-onlyThe date and time when all of the files became available.
cache_row_idintRead-onlyThe unique ID in the response cache.
commandstringRequiredThe command to run.
command_timeoutintOptionalLimit on how long the command can execute before it terminates.
content_setid_referenceOptionalThe ID of the content set to associate with the package.
creation_timestringRead-onlyThe date and time when this object was created in the database.
deleted_flagintRead-onlyValue is 1 if the package_spec is deleted, 0 if the package_spec is active.

Allowed values:0,1

display_namestringOptionalThe name of the package that displays in the user interface.
expire_secondsintOptionalThis value is added to the command_timeout to determine how long the action is active before it is considered expired.
file_templatespackage_file_template_listOptionalThe list of files to distribute, where file is determined by parameter substitution.
filespackage_file_listOptionalThe list of files to distribute.
hidden_flagintOptionalIf set to 1, this object does not display to end users. If no source_id value is specified, the default value of hidden_flag is false. If a source_id value is specified, the default value of hidden_flag is true.

Allowed values:0,1

idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the package_spec object.
last_modified_bystringRead-onlyThe user who most recently modified this object.
last_updatestringRead-onlyThe most recent date and time when this object was modified.
metadatametadata_listRead-onlyA list of metadata_item objects that describe this object.
mod_useruserRead-onlyThe user who most recently modified this object.
modification_timestringRead-onlyThe most recent date and time when this object was modified.
namestringRequiredThe unique name of the package_spec object.
parameter_definitionstringOptionalA string that contains custom parameters to send with the package.
parametersparameter_listOptionalA list of parameters to send with the package.
process_group_flagintOptionalIf value is 1, Tanium 7.1+ clients run the package command in a process group, and kill any remaining descendant processes when the package command completes. This setting is not used by pre-7.1 clients. Default value is false.

Allowed values:0,1

sensorssensor_listOptionalA list of sensors to include in the package.
signaturestringOptionalA value that is verified if the server license requires signed content.
skip_lock_flagintOptionalSet to 1 to enable locked clients to execute actions that include this package.

Allowed values:0,1

source_hash_changed_flagintOptionalApplicable only to derived packages.
For source package: the hash representation of current state of the source package, and it can change when certain properties of this package are modified.
For non-source package: the hash is copied from the source package at creation time and will not change.

Allowed values:0,1

source_idintOptionalThe ID of the package into which the parameters are substituted.
source_namestringOptionalThe name of the source package. This field is used by the import and export routes when IDs change.
source_hashstringOptionalDetects whether the derived package is out of sync with the source package.
verify_expire_secondsintOptionalA verification failure timeout. The clock begins with the start of the action. If the action cannot be verified by the timeout, the action status is reported as failed.
verify_groupgroupOptionalUse this to specify a verify group. A group is created if one does not exist.
verify_group_idintOptionalDeprecated. Use verify_group instead.

examples.title: Example
examples.content:
{

title: plugin
description:
A plugin is an extension to a Tanium core platform component or solution module.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
allow_restintOptional 
argumentsplugin_argument_listOptionalIf this is an SQL plugin, this list contains arguments supplied to the query.
bundlestringOptionalThe bundle that contains this plugin.
cache_row_idintOptionalThe unique ID in the response cache.
commandsplugin_command_listOptionalThe list of commands run by the plugin.
content_setcontent_setOptionalThe ID of the content_set to associate with the plugin.
execution_idintOptionalIf this is a detached plugin request, this field contains the ID used to look up the results. If this is supplied in a GET request, the status is returned.
exit_codeintOptionalIf the plugin is a script type, this field contains the exit code.
filenamestringOptionalThe file that contains the plugin definition.
inputstringOptionalIf the plugin is a script, this field contains the value passed to the stdin of the script.
local_admin_flagintOptional

Allowed values:0,1

metadatametadata_listOptionalA list of metadata_item objects that describe this object.
namestringOptionalThe unique name of the plugin.
pathstringOptionalThe path where the commands run and where the definition file resides.
permissionspermission_listOptionalThe list of permissions required to use this plugin.
plugin_serverstringOptionalIf multiple plugin servers exist, use this field to specify the server to run the plugin.
plugin_urlstringOptionalIf this is a remote plugin, this field specifies the URI to access the plugin. For example: /plugin/foo/bar
raw_http_requestintOptional 
raw_http_responseintOptional 
run_detached_flagintOptionalThis plugin execution request responds immediately when the plugin runs in the background.
script_responsestringOptionalIf the plugin is a script type, this field contains the response object.
sql_responseplugin_sqlOptionalIf the plugin is an SQL type, this field contains the response object.
statusstringRead-onlyThe status of the plugin execution. Possible values include:
  • Not Started
  • Running
  • Completed
  • Failed
status_file_contentstringOptionalThe contents of the status file, if supplied in the run request. The status file location is stored in the environment variable PLUGIN_STATUS_FILE. Any plugins that want content here should populate that file.
timeout_secondsintOptionalThe maximum run-time of a plugin, in seconds. Default is 10 seconds.
typestringOptionalThe plugin type, either SQL or script. Return data only.
use_json_flagintOptional

Allowed values:0,1

Used by:

ObjectField
plugin_listplugin

name: NonePlugin_list

title: plugin_schedule
description:
When you create a plugin schedule, the Tanium server runs the specified plugin based on the definition. Each execution runs as the user that created the schedule.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
argumentsplugin_argument_listOptionalFor an SQL plugin, this list contains the arguments supplied to the query.
deleted_flagintRead-onlyValue is true if the plugin_schedule is deleted, false if the plugin_schedule is active.

Allowed values:0,1

enabledintOptionalValue is 1 if the schedule is enabled, 0 if the schedule is disabled.

Allowed values:0,1

end_datestringOptionalIf supplied, the schedule only runs until the specified date.
end_hourintOptionalIf supplied, the schedule only runs until the specified hour on each day.
idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the plugin_schedule object.
inputstringOptionalFor script plugins, contains the value passed to the stdin of the script.
last_exit_codeintRead-onlyThe exit code of last run.
last_run_sqlplugin_sqlRead-onlyThe SQL output, if applicable.
last_run_textstringRead-onlyIf the plugin is not SQL, contains the output.
last_run_timestringRead-onlyThe most recent time when the plugin ran.
modification_timestringOptionalThe most recent date and time when this object was modified.
mod_useruserRead-onlyThe user who most recently modified this object.
namestringOptionalThe unique name of this schedule.
plugin_bundlestringOptionalThe bundle to include the plugin.
plugin_namestringOptionalThe name of the plugin to run.
plugin_serverstringOptionalThe server that contains the plugin.
run_interval_secondsintOptionalThe interval between plugin runs.
run_on_daysstringOptionalIf supplied, plugin only runs on the specified days. Values must be separated by commas. For example: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun.
start_datestringOptionalIf supplied, the schedule only runs after the specified date.
start_hourintOptionalIf supplied, the schedule only runs between start_hour and end_hour: Value values are 0 to 23.
useruserRead-onlyThe plugin runs under this user name.

Used by:

ObjectField
plugin_schedule_listplugin_schedule

title: question
description:
The definition for a Tanium question. Use a question to obtain key pieces of information from managed enterprise endpoints. A question object contains a list of data to retrieve (the "selects"), plus a group that defines the set of machines from which to retrieve the data.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
action_tracking_flagintOptionalIndicates this question is intended to track action status history. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this field is derived from the saved question.

Allowed values:0,1

context_groupgroupOptionalThe context in which the question is asked, similar to management_rights_group but not tied to the user/session context. Use this field to narrow the group of machines from which to retrieve data.
expirationstringRead-onlyThe date and time when the question expires. Format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss. For example, 2012-07-24T12:31:00.
expire_secondsintOptionalThe number of seconds before the question expires. Default is 600.
force_computer_id_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, force the question to not be a counting question if only one select is present. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this field is derived from the saved question.

Allowed values:0,1

from_canonical_textintOptionalOnly included on output of question parser results, and the value is 1 if the question text was canonically (unambiguously) understood.
hidden_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, this object is not visible to end users. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this field is derived from the saved question.

Allowed values:0,1

idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the question object.
indexintOptionalSpecifies the order in which questions/saved_questions are merged when using the GetMergedResultData command. All or none of the questions/saved_questions in the object_list must specify an index, and if the index values are specified, they must be contiguous and begin with 0 and not include any duplicate values.
is_expiredintRead-onlyValue is 1 if the question expired, value is 0 if the question is active.

Allowed values:0,1

management_rights_groupgroupRead-onlyThe management rights group of the user at the time the question was issued.
namestringOptionalThe name for the question. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this field is derived from the saved question.
query_textstringOptionalThe textual representation of the question. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this field is derived from the saved question.
saved_questionsaved_questionOptionalThe saved question, if any, associated to question.
selectsselect_listOptionalThe list of data to retrieve.
skip_lock_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, clients ignore the value of the skip_lock client setting.

Allowed values:0,1

useruserRead-onlyThe user who created / issued this question. The question is only answered by machines that were members of the user's management rights group when the question was issued.

{

         {

            "sensor" : {

            },

            "utf8_flag" : false,
            "value" : ".*Yes.*",
            "value_type" : "String"
         },
         {

            "all_values_flag" : false,
            "delimiter" : "",

            "ignore_case_flag" : true,
            "max_age_seconds" : 0,

            "operator" : "RegexMatch",
            "sensor" : {
               "hash" : 2721439124
            },
            "substring_flag" : false,
            "substring_length" : 0,
            "substring_start" : 0,
            "utf8_flag" : false,
            "value" : ".*True.*",
            "value_type" : "String"
         }
      ],
      "id" : 19,
      "not_flag" : false,
      "sub_groups" : [],
      "text" : " ( all Is Virtual contains Yes and Is Windows contains True )",
      "type" : 0
   },
   "hidden_flag" : false,
   "id" : 14,
   "is_expired" : true,
   "management_rights_group" : {
      "id" : 0
   },
   "name" : "",
   "query_text" : "Get Tanium Client Explicit Setting[LogVerbosityLevel] from all machines with ( all Is Virtual contains Yes and Is Windows contains True )",
   "saved_question" : {
      "id" : 14
   },
   "selects" : [
      {
         "filter" : {
            "aggregation" : "Sum",
            "all_times_flag" : false,
            "all_values_flag" : false,
            "delimiter" : "",
            "delimiter_index" : 0,
            "end_time" : "2001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
            "ignore_case_flag" : true,
            "max_age_seconds" : 0,
            "not_flag" : false,
            "operator" : "Less",
            "start_time" : "2001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
            "substring_flag" : false,
            "substring_length" : 0,
            "substring_start" : 0,
            "utf8_flag" : false,
            "value" : "",
            "value_type" : "String"
         },
         "sensor" : {
            "category" : "",
            "content_set" : {
               "id" : 3,
               "name" : "Base"
            },
            "delimiter" : "",
            "description" : "",
            "exclude_from_parse_flag" : true,
            "hash" : "3478891093",
            "hidden_flag" : false,
            "id" : 4294967291,
            "ignore_case_flag" : true,
            "keep_duplicates_flag" : false,
            "max_age_seconds" : 900,
            "name" : "Tanium Client Explicit Setting[LogVerbosityLevel]",
            "parameter_definition" : "{"parameters":[{"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"key":"setting","promptText":"Enter the Client Setting Name","label":"Client Setting Name","helpString":"The Client Setting Name must be typed exactly as it appears in the client registry, including *    necessary underscores. NOTE: most settings have no spaces (Example: LogVerbosityLevel)","value":"","defaultValue":"","restrict":null,"maxChars":64,"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}",
            "parameters" : [
               {
                  "key" : "||setting||",
                  "value" : "LogVerbosityLevel"
               }
            ],
            "queries" : [
               {
                  "platform" : "Windows",
                  "script" : "'========================================
' Registry Value Data
'========================================
'@INCLUDE=i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs

'Columns:
' User | Data | Type | Architecture | KeyPath | Value

' Value is a hidden column for later use in sensor-fed actions (modify, delete)

strKey = "HKLM\"&GetTaniumRegistryPath()
strValue = UTF8Decode("LogVerbosityLevel") ' Version

'strValue = "Version"

'strKey = *    "HKEY_USERS\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings"
'strValue = "Emailname"
strSep = "~~"


'Constants for value types
Const REG_SZ        = 1
Const REG_EXPAND_SZ = 2
Const REG_BINARY    = 3
Const REG_DWORD     = 4
Const REG_MULTI_SZ  = 7
Const REG_QWORD     = 11
Const MAX_UNSIGNED_LONG = 4294967295


'Split up strKey into the hive constant and the registry key
words = Split(strKey, "\")
strHive = words(0)
constHive = *    GetHiveConst(strHive)

strKey = Right(strKey, Len(strKey) - Len(strHive) -1)

'Global for Username
Dim strUserName
strUserName = "N/A" ' default value, overridden if HKEY_USERS hive

'Set up registry objects for 32-bit, then check value
'Need to check all values of key in order to get type
Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(32)
Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx)

If strHive = "HKEY_USERS" Then
' go through each User's hive
	For Each strUserKey In GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, *    constHive, "")
		If Not InStr(strUserKey,"_Classes") > 0 Then ' ignore _Classes entries
			strUserName = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strUserKey)
			If strUserName = False Then strUserName = strUserKey
			strFullUserKey = strUserKey&"\"&strKey
			hasValues32 = CheckValues(objReg, objCTX, constHive, strFullUserKey, strValue, 32)
			If hasValues32 Then hasAnyResult = True
		End If
	Next
Else ' was another hive
	hasValues32 = CheckValues(objReg, *    objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, 32)
	If hasValues32 Then hasAnyResult = True
End If


If Is64 Then
	Set objCtx = GetObjCtx(64)
	Set objReg = GetObjReg(objCtx)
	If strHive = "HKEY_USERS" Then
	' go through each User's hive in 64-bit context
		For Each strUserKey In GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, "")
		If Not InStr(strUserKey,"_Classes") > 0 Then ' ignore _Classes entries
				strUserName = GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strUserKey)
				If *    strUserName = False Then strUserName = strUserKey
				strFullUserKey = strUserKey&"\"&strKey
				hasValues64 = CheckValues(objReg, objCTX, constHive, strFullUserKey, strValue, 64)
				If hasValues64 Then hasAnyResult = True	
			End If
		Next
	Else ' was another hive
		hasValues64 = CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, 64)
		If hasValues64 Then hasAnyResult = True
	End If
End If

If Not (hasAnyResult) Then
	WScript.Echo *    "Key/Value not found"
End If

Function GetTaniumRegistryPath
'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32
'looks for a valid Path value

    Dim objShell
    Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
      
    Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
    
    keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client"
    keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
    
    ' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit *    machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode)
    On Error Resume Next
    strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path")
    On Error Goto 0
    strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
 
    If strPath = "" Then
        ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node
        On Error Resume Next
        strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path")
        On Error Goto 0
        strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyWoWPath
    *    End If
    
    If Not strPath = "" Then
        GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
    Else
        GetTaniumRegistryPath = False
        WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path"
    End If
End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath

Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey)
	Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes
	If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then
		RegKeyExists = *    True
	Else
		RegKeyExists = False
	End If
End Function 'RegKeyExists

'Goes through all values in a key, returns True if strValue is found
Function CheckValues(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, intBit)

	Dim Inparams, Outparams
	Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumValues").Inparameters
	Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive
	Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey
	Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumValues", Inparams,,objCtx)
	
	arrNames = *    Outparams.sNames
	arrTypes = Outparams.Types

	If Not IsNull(arrNames) Then
		For i = LBound(arrNames) To UBound(arrNames)
			strValueName = arrNames(i)
			
			'if strValue is found, echo
			If LCase(strValueName) = LCase(strValue) Then
				EchoValue objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, arrTypes(i), intBit
				CheckValues = True
				Exit Function
			End If
		Next
	End If
	CheckValues = False
End Function

Function *    GetDisplayString(strKey, strType, strValue, intBit)
	If intBit = 64 Then
		strArch = "64-bit"
	Else
		strArch = "32-bit"
	End If
			
	GetDisplayString = strValue
End Function

Function EchoValue(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey, strValue, constType, intBit)
	' Note the key that was being searched, will be a hidden column
	strOutputKey = strHive&"\"&strKey
	
	Dim objInParams, objOutParams
	Select Case constType
		Case REG_SZ  
			Set *    objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetStringValue").InParameters
			objInParams.hDefKey = constHive
			objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey
			objInParams.sValueName = strValue			
			Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
			
			WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_SZ", objOutParams.sValue, intBit)
		Case REG_EXPAND_SZ
			Set objInParams = *    objReg.Methods_("GetExpandedStringValue").InParameters
			objInParams.hDefKey = constHive
			objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey
			objInParams.sValueName = strValue			
			Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetExpandedStringValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
			
			WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_EXPAND_SZ", objOutParams.sValue, intBit)
		Case REG_BINARY
			Set objInParams = *    objReg.Methods_("GetBinaryValue").InParameters
			objInParams.hDefKey = constHive
			objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey
			objInParams.sValueName = strValue			
			Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetBinaryValue", objInParams, , objCtx)

			strBytes = ""
			For Each uByte in objOutParams.uValue
				strTemp = Hex(uByte)
				If Len(strTemp) < 2 Then
					strTemp = "0" & strTemp
				End If	
				strBytes = strBytes & *    strTemp & " "
			Next
			
			WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_BINARY", strBytes, intBit)
		Case REG_DWORD
		    Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetDWordValue").InParameters
		    objInParams.hDefKey = constHive
		    objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey
		    objInParams.sValueName = strValue
		    Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetDWordValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
		
			' DWords are treated as signed longs.  Need to *    convert to unsigned
			dblValue = CDbl(objOutParams.uValue)
			If dblValue < 0 Then
				dblValue = dblValue + MAX_UNSIGNED_LONG + 1
			End If
		
			WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_DWORD", CStr(dblValue), intBit)
		Case REG_QWORD
		    Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetQWordValue").InParameters
		    objInParams.hDefKey = constHive
		    objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey
		    objInParams.sValueName = strValue
		    Set *    objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetQWordValue", objInParams, , objCtx)
		
			WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_QWORD", CStr(objOutParams.uValue), intBit)
		Case REG_MULTI_SZ
		    Set objInParams = objReg.Methods_("GetMultiStringValue").InParameters
		    objInParams.hDefKey = constHive
		    objInParams.sSubKeyName = strKey
		    objInParams.sValueName = strValue
		    Set objOutParams = objReg.ExecMethod_("GetMultiStringValue", *    objInParams, , objCtx)
		
			arrValues = objOutParams.sValue
			strResponse = ""

			For Each strTemp In arrValues
				If strResponse = "" Then
					strResponse = strTemp
				Else
					strResponse = strResponse & vbCrLf & strTemp
				End If
			Next
		
			WScript.Echo GetDisplayString(strKey, "REG_MULTI_SZ", strResponse, intBit)
	End Select
End Function


Function GetObjCtx(intArch)
	Dim objCtx
	Set objCtx = *    CreateObject("WbemScripting.SWbemNamedValueSet")
	objCtx.Add "__ProviderArchitecture", intArch
	objCtx.Add "__RequiredArchitecture", TRUE
	Set GetObjCtx = objCtx
End Function

Function GetObjReg(objCtx)
	Dim objLocator, objServices
	Set objLocator = CreateObject("Wbemscripting.SWbemLocator")
	Set objServices = objLocator.ConnectServer("","root\default","","",,,,objCtx)
	Set GetObjReg = objServices.Get("StdRegProv") 
End Function

Function *    GetSubKeys(objReg, objCtx, constHive, strKey)
	Dim Inparams, Outparams
	Set Inparams = objReg.Methods_("EnumKey").Inparameters
	Inparams.Hdefkey = constHive
	Inparams.sSubkeyname = strKey
	Set Outparams = objReg.ExecMethod_("EnumKey", Inparams,,objCtx)
	GetSubKeys = Outparams.sNames
End Function

Function Is64 
	Dim objWMIService, colItems, objItem
	Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\CIMV2")
	Set colItems = *    objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select SystemType from Win32_ComputerSystem")    
	For Each objItem In colItems
		If InStr(LCase(objItem.SystemType), "x64") > 0 Then
			Is64 = True
		Else
			Is64 = False
		End If		
	Next
End Function


Function GetHiveConst(hive)
	Const HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT   = &H80000000
	Const HKEY_CURRENT_USER   = &H80000001
	Const HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE  = &H80000002
	Const HKEY_USERS          = &H80000003

	Select Case *    UCase(hive)
		Case "HKLM"
			GetHiveConst = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
		Case "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE"
			GetHiveConst = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
		Case "HKCR"
			GetHiveConst = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT
		Case "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT"
			GetHiveConst = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT
		Case "HKEY_CURRENT_USER"
			GetHiveConst = HKEY_CURRENT_USER
		Case "HKEY_USERS"
			GetHiveConst = HKEY_USERS
	End Select
	
	If IsEmpty(GetHiveConst) Then
		WScript.Echo *    "Invalid registry hive: " & hive
		WScript.Quit
	End If
End Function

Function GetUserForSIDLocal(objReg,strSID)
' This function converts a SID to a user name
' by doing a registry lookup, avoiding an LDAP query
' this will fail in the case where the user's name was changed in AD
' as they will still have their old home directory name

	Const HKLM = &h80000002
	
	Dim strHiveListKey,strUserData,intDatPos,intFinalBackslashPos
	
	strHiveListKey = *    "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\hivelist"
	objReg.GetStringValue HKLM,strHiveListKey,"\Registry\User\"&strSID,strUserData
	If Not IsNull(strUserData) Then
	' strUserData would look like
	' \Device\HarddiskVolume2\Users\user.name\NTUSER.DAT
		intDatPos = InStr(UCase(strUserData),"\NTUSER.DAT")
		' strip off the dat file
		If intDatPos > 0 Then ' must be in string
			strUserData = Left(strUserData,intDatPos - 1)
			' find last *    backslash
			intFinalBackslashPos = InStrRev(strUserData,"\")
			' get right from that pos
			strUserData = Right(strUserData,Len(strUserData) - intFinalBackslashPos)
			GetUserForSIDLocal = strUserData
		Else
			strUserData = False
		End If
	Else
		GetUserForSIDLocal = False
	End If
End Function 'GetUserForSIDLocal
'------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point -----
'- Begin file: *    i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs
'========================================
' UTF8Decode
'========================================
' Used to convert the UTF-8 style parameters passed from 
' the server to sensors in sensor parameters.
' This function should be used to safely pass non english input to sensors.

' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs


Function UTF8Decode(str)
    Dim arraylist(), strLen, i, sT, val, depth, sR
    Dim arraysize
    *    arraysize = 0
    strLen = Len(str)
    for i = 1 to strLen
        sT = mid(str, i, 1)
        if sT = "%" then
            if i + 2 <= strLen then
                Redim Preserve arraylist(arraysize + 1)
                arraylist(arraysize) = cbyte("&H" & mid(str, i + 1, 2))
                arraysize = arraysize + 1
                i = i + 2
            end if
        else
            Redim Preserve arraylist(arraysize + 1)
            arraylist(arraysize) = *    asc(sT)
            arraysize = arraysize + 1
        end if
    next
    depth = 0
    for i = 0 to arraysize - 1
		Dim mybyte
        mybyte = arraylist(i)
        if mybyte and &h80 then
            if (mybyte and &h40) = 0 then
                if depth = 0 then
                    Err.Raise 5
                end if
                val = val * 2 ^ 6 + (mybyte and &h3f)
                depth = depth - 1
                if depth = 0 then
                    sR *    = sR & chrw(val)
                    val = 0
                end if
            elseif (mybyte and &h20) = 0 then
                if depth > 0 then Err.Raise 5
                val = mybyte and &h1f
                depth = 1
            elseif (mybyte and &h10) = 0 then
                if depth > 0 then Err.Raise 5
                val = mybyte and &h0f
                depth = 2
            else
                Err.Raise 5
            end if
        else
            *    if depth > 0 then Err.Raise 5
            sR = sR & chrw(mybyte)
        end if
    next
    if depth > 0 then Err.Raise 5
    UTF8Decode = sR
End Function
'- End file: i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs",

description:
Contains the server response for the Get question results by ID, Get question result info by ID, and Get merged result data for multiple questions routes.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
ageintRead-only 
archived_question_idintRead-onlyThe ID of the archived_question object, if any.
error_countintRead-only 
estimated_totalintRead-only 
expire_secondsintRead-onlyThe duration, in seconds, until the question expires.
max_available_ageintRead-only 
nowintRead-onlyThe date and time when these results were retrieved.
idintRead-onlyThe ID of the saved_question object, if any.
issue_secondsintRead-only 
mr_passedintRead-onlyThe number of machines that match the question filter and are within the groups to which you have access. For example, if you get computer name from Windows machines, mr_passed would be the number of Windows machines in the groups to which you have access.
mr_testedintRead-onlyThe number of machines that evaluated the question filter and are within the groups to which you have access. For example, if you get computer name from Windows machines, mr_tested would be the number of machines in the groups that you have access to and that evaluated if they were Windows machines (the machines do not need to be Windows machines). When the value of estimated_total matches mr_tested, the question results are ready to be retrieved.

report_countintRead-onlyThe number of endpoints that responded to the question.
row_countintRead-onlyThe number of different answers returned. For example, the question Get Online from all machines could return a report_count of 100,000 and a row_count of 2 (true and false).

row_count_machinesintRead-only

testedintRead-only

title: saved_action
description:
A scheduled action that can be reissued multiple times.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
action_groupgroupRequiredThe group of clients to target.
action_group_idlongOptionalDeprecated. Use action_group instead.
approved_flagintRead-onlyValue is 1 if the saved action is approved, 0 if not approved.

Allowed values:0,1

approveruserRead-onlyThe user to approve the saved action.
cache_row_idintRead-onlyThe unique ID in the response cache.
commentstringOptional 
creation_timestringRead-onlyThe date and time when this object was created in the database.
distribute_secondsintOptionalThe number of seconds over which to deploy the action.
end_timestringOptionalThe date and time to stop issuing actions.
expire_secondsintRequiredThe duration from the start time before the action expires.
idlongOptionalThe unique ID of the saved_action object.
issue_countintRead-onlyThe number of times the scheduled action issued an action.
issue_secondsintOptionalHow often to reissue an action from the saved action.
last_actionactionOptionalThe action object that was issued last.
last_start_timestringRead-onlyThe most recent date and time that the action started.
metadatametadata_listOptionalA list of metadata_item objects that describe this object.
namestringOptionalThe name of the saved_action object.
next_start_timestringRead-onlyThe next date and time when the action will start.
package_specpackage_specRequiredThe package deployed by the saved action.
policysaved_action_policyOptionalThe policy definition of the saved action.
policy_flagintOptionalValue is 0 if the policy is not in use, value is 1 if the policy is in use.

Allowed values:0,1

public_flagintOptionalNot used.
row_ids saved_action_row_id_listOptional 
start_timestringOptionalThe date and time when the action became active. An empty string or null starts immediately.

The policy that applies to the parent saved_action object.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription

min_countintOptionalThe number of matching machines required to issue the saved_action. Defaults to the global setting policy_default_min_count.
row_filter_groupgroupOptional 
row_filter_group_idlongOptionalDeprecated. Use row_filter_group instead.
saved_question_groupgroupOptionalThe group of saved actions that this policy affects.
saved_question_group_idlongOptionalDeprecated. Use saved_question_group.
saved_question_idlongOptionalThe ID of the saved_question that this policy affects.

name: NoneSaved_action_row_id_list

title: saved_question
description:
Use a saved_question to issue a question at a later time.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
action_tracking_flagintOptionalIf value is 1, indicates this question is intended to track action status history.

Allowed values:0,1

archive_enabled_flagintOptionalIf value is 1, archiving is enabled.

Allowed values:0,1

archive_owneruserOptionalThe user that owns the archive. Archives can be shared between users with identical management rights groups.
cache_row_idintOptionalThe unique ID in the response cache.
content_setid_referenceOptionalThe ID of the content_set to associate with the saved question.
expire_secondsintOptionalThe duration before each issuance of the question expires, in seconds. Default value is 600.
hidden_flagintOptionalIf value is 1, this is an internal object that does not appear to end users.

Allowed values:0,1

idintRead-onlyThe unique id of the saved_question object.
indexintOptionalSpecifies the order in which questions and saved_questions are merged when using the Get merged result data for multiple questions route. All or none of the questions and saved_questions in the list must specify an index. If the index values are specified, they must be contiguous, begin with 0, and not include any duplicate values.
issue_secondsintOptionalHow often to reissue the question when active, in seconds. Default value is 120.
issue_seconds_never_flagintOptionalIf value is 1, this question is not reissued automatically.

Allowed values:0,1

keep_secondsintOptionalHow long to save result data in the archive.
metadatametadata_listOptionalA list of metadata_item objects that describe this object.
mod_timestringOptionalThe most recent date and time when this object was modified.
mod_useruserOptionalThe user who most recently modified this object.
most_recent_question_idintOptionalThe ID of the most recently issued question object generated by this saved_question.
namestringRequiredThe name of the saved_question object. You can refer to the saved_question object by name, but if the name is not unique, an error may occur.
packagespackage_spec_listOptionalThe packages associated with this saved question and available to be deployed.
public_flagintOptionalIf the value is 0, only the user that owns this object can see the object.

Allowed values:0,1

query_textstringOptionalThe textual representation of the question.
questionquestionRequiredThe question from which to create the saved question.
row_count_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, only the row count data is saved when archiving this question.

Allowed values:0,1

seeding_question_idsstringOptionalFor creation only. If set, the server populates the initial result data from the specified questions. Use this field to copy recent data from one saved question, or from multiple questions, to this saved question to create the recent data set. Seeding questions must have the following:
  • The same group right as the defintion question
  • The force_computer_id_flag = 1, same for the defintion question
  • At least one overlapping column with the defintion question
You must trigger reissue right after creating the saved question for this to work.
skip_schedule_on_update_flagintOptionalIndicates whether to create or update existing reissue schedule on when updating the saved_question object.

Allowed values:0,1

sort_columnintOptionalThe column to use as the default sort column if no sort_order is specified.
useruserOptionalThe user who owns this object.

Used by:

ObjectField
actionhistory_saved_question
questionsaved_question
saved_question_listsaved_question

title: select
description:
Select objects can be filtered by a simple filter, by a group, or both. First, items are checked to see if they are a member of all of the sub_groups (if the and_flag is set), or any of the sub_groups (if the and_flag is not set) Second, items are checked to see if they pass all of the filters ( if the and_flag is set), or any of the filters (if the and_flag is not set) If the not_flag is set, the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded. If no subgroups are specified, all items are included, and if no filters are specified, all items are included.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
filterfilterOptionalOnly retrieve values that pass this filter.
groupgroupOptionalOnly retrieve members of this group.
sensorsensorOptionalThe sensor whose values are retrieved.

Used by:

ObjectField
select_listselect

      "delimiter" : ",",
      "description" : "Provided with a parameter indicating the path to a file in the Tanium client directory, returns the version of the file in the specified location.
Example: True",
      "exclude_from_parse_flag" : true,
      "hash" : "1286894197",
      "hidden_flag" : false,
      "id" : 22,
      "ignore_case_flag" : true,
      "keep_duplicates_flag" : false,
      "last_modified_by" : "TaniumAdmin",
      "max_age_seconds" : 900,
      "mod_user" : {

         "domain" : "TAM",
         "id" : 1,
