      },
      "modification_time" : "2018-08-13T18:02:34Z",
      "name" : "Tanium File Version",
      "parameter_definition" : "{"parameters":[{"validationExpressions":[{"helpString":"Value can not be blank","flags":"","expression":"^\\S","parameterType":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression","model":"com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression"}],"key":"filePath","promptText":"e.g. uninst.exe or Tools\\Wsusscn2.cab","label":"Relative file path from <Tanium Client Installation Dir>","helpString":"Starting from the Client installation directory, *    complete the file path to get version for.","value":"","defaultValue":"","restrict":null,"maxChars":0,"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter"}],"parameterType":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray","model":"com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray"}",
      "queries" : [
         {
            "platform" : "Windows",
            "script" : "'========================================
' Tanium File Version
'========================================
'@INCLUDE=i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs
'@INCLUDE=utils/settings/GetClientDir.vbs
'@INCLUDE=utils/fileprops/GetFileVersion.vbs

Option Explicit

Dim strFilePath, strClientPath, strAbsoluteFilePath, strVersion

strFilePath = UTF8Decode("||filePath||")
strFilePath =  GetClientDir() & strFilePath
strClientPath = GetClientDir()

Dim fso
Set fso = *    WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")

If fso.FileExists(strFilePath) Then
	strAbsoluteFilePath = fso.GetAbsolutePathName(strFilePath)
	
	If LCase(Left(strAbsoluteFilePath, Len(strClientPath))) = LCase(strClientPath) Then 
		strVersion = GetFileVersion(strAbsoluteFilePath)

		If strVersion = GET_FILE_VERSION_NOT_AVAILALBE Then
			WScript.Echo "Version not found"
		Else
			WScript.Echo strVersion
		End If	
	Else
		WScript.Echo "Not *    Within Client Directory"
	End If
Else
	WScript.Echo "File does not exist"
End If

'------------ INCLUDES after this line. Do not edit past this point -----
'- Begin file: i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs
'========================================
' UTF8Decode
'========================================
' Used to convert the UTF-8 style parameters passed from 
' the server to sensors in sensor parameters.
' This function should be used to safely pass non english input to sensors.

' *    To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs


Function UTF8Decode(str)
    Dim arraylist(), strLen, i, sT, val, depth, sR
    Dim arraysize
    arraysize = 0
    strLen = Len(str)
    for i = 1 to strLen
        sT = mid(str, i, 1)
        if sT = "%" then
            if i + 2 <= strLen then
                Redim Preserve arraylist(arraysize + 1)
                arraylist(arraysize) = cbyte("&H" & mid(str, i + 1, 2))
                arraysize = *    arraysize + 1
                i = i + 2
            end if
        else
            Redim Preserve arraylist(arraysize + 1)
            arraylist(arraysize) = asc(sT)
            arraysize = arraysize + 1
        end if
    next
    depth = 0
    for i = 0 to arraysize - 1
		Dim mybyte
        mybyte = arraylist(i)
        if mybyte and &h80 then
            if (mybyte and &h40) = 0 then
                if depth = 0 then
                    Err.Raise *    5
                end if
                val = val * 2 ^ 6 + (mybyte and &h3f)
                depth = depth - 1
                if depth = 0 then
                    sR = sR & chrw(val)
                    val = 0
                end if
            elseif (mybyte and &h20) = 0 then
                if depth > 0 then Err.Raise 5
                val = mybyte and &h1f
                depth = 1
            elseif (mybyte and &h10) = 0 then
                if depth > 0 then *    Err.Raise 5
                val = mybyte and &h0f
                depth = 2
            else
                Err.Raise 5
            end if
        else
            if depth > 0 then Err.Raise 5
            sR = sR & chrw(mybyte)
        end if
    next
    if depth > 0 then Err.Raise 5
    UTF8Decode = sR
End Function
'- End file: i18n/UTF8Decode.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/settings/GetClientDir.vbs
' Returns the directory of the client
' Note:  GetClientDir always *    returns ending with a \
' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/settings/GetClientDir.vbs


Function GetClientDir()
	Dim strResult
	
	strResult = GetEnvironmentValue("TANIUM_CLIENT_ROOT")
	
	If IsNull(strResult) Then 
		Dim objSh
		strResult = ""
		Set objSh = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
	
		On Error Resume Next
		If strResult="" Then strResult=Eval("objSh.RegRead(""HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\Path"")") : *    Err.Clear
		If strResult="" Then strResult=Eval("objSh.RegRead(""HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\Path"")") : Err.Clear
		If strResult="" Then Err.Clear
		On Error Goto 0
	End If
	
	If strResult="" Then Call fRaiseError(5, "GetClientDir", _
		"TSE-Error:Can not locate client directory", False)
		
	If Right(strResult, 1) <> "\" Then strResult = strResult & "\"

	GetClientDir = strResult
End Function
'- End file: *    utils/settings/GetClientDir.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/RaiseError.vbs
' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/RaiseError.vbs

Function fRaiseError(errCode, errSource, errorMsg, RaiseError)
    If RaiseError Then
      On Error Resume Next
      Call Err.Raise(errCode, errSource, errorMsg)
      Exit Function
    Else
      WScript.Echo errorMsg
      Wscript.Quit
    End If
End Function
'- End file: utils/RaiseError.vbs
'- Begin file: *    utils/os/GetEnvironmentValue.vbs
' Returns the passed in environment variable value.
' Returns either the value as set in the environment, or Null if not set

' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/os/GetEnvironmentValue.vbs


Function GetEnvironmentValue(strName) 
	Dim objShell, strSub, strResult
	Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
	strSub = "%" & strName & "%"
	strResult = objShell.ExpandEnvironmentStrings(strSub)
	
	If strResult = strSub *    Then 
		GetEnvironmentValue = Null
	Else 
		GetEnvironmentValue = strResult
	End If
End Function ' GetEnvironmentValue
'- End file: utils/os/GetEnvironmentValue.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/fileprops/GetFileVersion.vbs
' Returns the version information of the file given

' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/fileprops/GetFileVersion.vbs


Const GET_FILE_VERSION_NOT_AVAILALBE = "N/A"

Function GetFileVersion(strPath)
	' Returns the version of a file.  *    Returns GET_FILE_VERSION_NOT_AVAILABLE if the 
	' file does not have a version, or empty string ("") if the file does not exist
	Dim objFSO, strVersion, strResult
	Set objFSO = WScript.CreateObject("Scripting.Filesystemobject")

	strResult = ""

	If objFSO.FileExists(strPath) Then
		strVersion = objFSO.GetFileVersion(strPath)
		
		If strVersion <> "" Then
			strResult = strVersion
		Else
			strResult = GET_FILE_VERSION_NOT_AVAILALBE
		End *    If
	End If

	GetFileVersion = strResult
End Function ' GetFileVersion
'- End file: utils/fileprops/GetFileVersion.vbs",

name: NoneSensor_list

title: sensor_query
description:
A script to run on a client.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
platformstringOptionalThe platform to run the script. Possible values include:
  • Windows
  • Linux
  • Solaris
  • AIX
  • Mac
Default value is Windows.
scriptstringOptionalThe script to run on the client.
script_typeintOptionalSpecifies how the script runs.
  • WMIQuery: run the script as a WMI Query
  • BESRelevance: run the script as a BigFix Relevance expression (using QNA)
  • VBScript: run the script as a VB Script (if platform is Windows then this is the default)
  • Powershell: run the script using PowerShell
  • JScript: run the script using JScript (Windows platform only). Enable UI support with global setting enable_python_jscript_type_flag.
  • Python: run the script using Python. This script is available on all platforms but requires separate dll/.so files to distribute to the endpoints. Enable UI support with the global setting enable_python_jscript_type_flag.
  • UnixShell: run the script as a shell script. Use #! notation to specify a specific shell program, otherwise /bin/sh is used (if platform is Linux, Solaris, AIX, or Mac, this is the default).
signaturestringOptionalA value to verify if the server license requires signed content.

Used by:

ObjectField
sensor_query_listquery

title: sensor_subcolumn
description:
A result returned by a sensor. Used by multicolumn sensors that return multiple results.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
exclude_from_parse_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, the string results of this subcolumn will not be matched by the natural language parser.

Allowed values:0,1

hidden_flagintOptional

If the value is 1, this is an internal object that should not be shown to end users. Allowed values:0,1

ignore_case_flagintOptionalIgnore case if the value is 1. Unlike most flags, this defaults to 1.

Allowed values:0,1

indexintOptionalThe index of the delimited sensor data represented by this column.
namestringOptionalThe name of the sensor subcolumn.
value_typestringOptionalSpecifies how the values are compared.
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are version strings, such as 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • BESDate: values are valid BES date strings
  • IPAddress: values are IP addresses
  • WMIDate: values are valid WMI date strings
  • TimeDiff: values are an expression of an amount of time, such as "2 years, 3 months, 18 days, 4 hours, 22 minutes, and 3.67 seconds" or "4.2 hours" (numeric + "Y|MO|W|D|H|M|S" units)
  • DataSize: values are an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • NumericInteger: values are integer numeric values

Used by:

ObjectField
sensor_subcolumn_listsubcolumn

title: server_throttle
description:
A server throttle controls the rate at which data is sent across all client connections. For example, use a server throttle to enforce "The server should never use more than 1 Mbps sending sensors to clients". Only one server_throttle object is active at any time. If multiple server_throttle objects exist, the server uses the server_throttle with the lowest ID (closest to 0).

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
bandwidth_bytes_limitintOptionalThe bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of 0 indicates no limit.
connection_limitintOptionalThe maximum number of connections to the server. The server rejects connections beyond this limit.
deleted_flagintRead-onlyValue is 1 if the server_throttle is deleted, 0 if the server_throttle is active.

Allowed values:0,1

download_bandwidth_bytes_limitintOptionalThe download bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of 0 indicates no limit.
download_connection_limitintOptionalThe maximum number of download connections to the server. The server rejects connections beyond this limit.
idintRead-onlyIf you specify a value for the ip_address field, the object is inactive.
ip_addressstringOptionalThe IP address to throttle traffic from.
namestringOptionalThe name of the server throttle.
sensor_bandwidth_bytes_limitintOptionalThe sensor bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of 0 indicates no limit.
sensor_connection_limitintOptionalThe maximum number of sensor connections to the server. The server rejects connections beyond this limit.

Used by:

ObjectField
server_throttle_listserver_throttle

   "delete_xml_url" : "",
   "deleted_flag" : 0,

title: action
description:
An action object contains a package to deploy and a group that defines the set of machines to receive the package. The server accepts an action for a package that requires parameters, even if you do not provide the parameters.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
action_groupgroupOptionalThe parent group of machines to target.
approveruserRead-onlyThe approver of this action.
cache_row_idintRead-onlyThe unique ID in the response cache.
creation_timestringRead-onlyThe date and time when this object was created in the database.
distribute_secondsintRead-onlyThe number of seconds over which to deploy the action.
expiration_timestringOptionalThe date and time when the action expires.
expire_secondsintOptionalHow long from the start time before the action expires. If you create an action without specifying this field, the action expires immediately. You can obtain the expire_seconds value from the package_spec object.
history_saved_questionsaved_questionRead-onlyThe saved question that tracks the results of the action.
idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the action object.
metadatametadata_listRead-onlyA list of metadata_item objects that describe this object.
namestringOptionalThe action name.
package_specpackage_specRequiredThe package deployed by this action. The server accepts packages that require parameters, even if you do not specify the parameters; the server does not validate any parameters or their contents.
saved_actionsaved_actionRead-onlyThe saved action that this action was issued from, if any.
skip_lock_flagintOptional

Allowed values:0,1

start_timestringRead-onlyThe date and time when the action became active.
statusstringRead-onlyThe status of the action. Valid values are Pending, Active, Stopped, or Expired.
stopped_flagintRead-onlyWhether an action stop has been issued for this action. A value of 1 indicates an action stop was issued.
target_groupgroupOptionalThe group of machines to target.
useruserRead-onlyThe user who issued this action.

Used by:

ObjectField

action_stopaction
saved_actionaction

title: auth
description:
When authentication is successful, the server responds with a session field. Subsequent requests need only supply the session. Each request extends the lifetime of the session. In some situations, the session string may change, so after each request the returned session string should be checked.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
as_exclusive_user_groupstringOptional 
domainstringOptionalThe domain of the user account.
passwordstringOptionalThe password for the user.
secondarystringOptionalWhen using an authentication plugin, this can be additional information needed to authenticate (such as secure token ID / LDAP server).
usernamestringOptionalThe name of the user.

Used by:

The auth object is not used by any other object.
name: Post_get_patchAuth

title: group
description:
A group object is a filter-based computer group. The membership of a group is calculated by testing each candidate item and either including it or excluding it from the group. First, items are checked to see if they are a member of all of the sub_groups (if and_flag is set), or any of the subgroups (if and_flag is not set). Second, items are checked to see if they pass all of the filters ( if and_flag is set), or any of the filters (if and_flag is not set). If the not_flag is set the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded. Note that if no sub_groups are specified, all items are included. If no filters are specified, all items are included, so an "empty" group means "All".

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
and_flagintOptional

 

Allowed values:0,1

deleted_flagintRead-only

Value is true if the group is deleted, false if the group is active.

Allowed values:0,1

filtersfilter_listOptional

A list of filters that define the the criteria for clients to be eligible for the group.

namestringOptional

A group name is optional, and by default groups are anonymous. If a name is supplied when you create or update the group, the name must be unique.

idintRead-only

The unique ID of the group object.

not_flagintOptional

Allowed values:0,1

parametersparameter_listOptional

A list of parameters to substitute into the source group.

saved_question_idintRead-only

The ID of the saved question that tracks computer IDs in this group. Named Group Only.

source_idintOptional

The source id of the group for parameterized groups.

sub_groupsgroup_listOptional

A group_list containing child group objects.

textstringOptional

A description of the clients that this group represents.

track_computer_id_flagintOptional

Set to 1 to enable the saved question that tracks the computer ID. Named groups only.

Allowed values:0,1

track_computer_id_intervalintOptional

Use when track_computer_id_flag is on. Default is 4 hours, minimum is 1 hour. Named groups only. If there are multiple originators (such as user or persona) for tracking, the server uses the most aggressive frequency to create or update the tracking saved question.

typeintOptional

Possible values:

  • 0 = Filter-based group
  • 1 = Action group
  • 2 = Action policy pair group
  • 3 = Ad hoc group
  • 4 = Manual group

title: sensor
description:
A sensor is a script that runs on a client. Sensors are defined by the sensor object that includes settings, script content, and script parameters.

Fields

FieldTypeRequiredDescription
cache_row_idintOptionalThe unique ID in the response cache.
categorystringOptionalThe category that includes this sensor.
content_setid_referenceOptionalThe ID of the content_set to associate with the sensor.
creation_timestringOptionalThe date and time when this object was created in the database.
delimiterstringOptionalOne or more characters used to split the result into subcolumns.
deleted_flagintOptionalValue is 1 if the sensor is deleted, 0 if the sensor is active.

Allowed values:0,1

descriptionstringOptionalA description for the sensor.
exclude_from_parse_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, the string results of this sensor will not be used by the natural language parser.

Allowed values:0,1

hashlongOptional 
hidden_flagintOptionalIf the value is 1, this is an internal object that should not be shown to end users.

Allowed values:0,1

idintRead-onlyThe unique ID of the sensor object.
ignore_case_flagintOptionalDefault is 1, which means case is ignored by default.

Allowed values:0,1

keep_duplicates_flagintOptionalSet to 1 to have clients preserve duplicate values in sensor results instead of only returning each unique value once.

Allowed values:0,1

last_modified_bystringOptionalThe name of the user who last modified this object.
max_age_secondsintOptionalHow old a sensor result can be before it is invalid. When results are half this value, the sensor is re-evaluated.
max_string_age_minutesintOptionalPurge result strings with values higher (older) than the last_used_minute value for the string. Set to 0 (the default) to disable.
max_stringsintOptionalThe maximum number of result strings to store for the sensor. When the number of strings exceeds this value, the server purges the oldest strings. Set to 0 (the default) to disable.
metadatametadata_listOptionalA list of metadata_item objects that describe this object.
mod_useruserOptionalThe user who most recently modified this object.
modification_timestringOptionalThe most recent date and time when this object was modified.
parameter_definitionsstringOptionalA string that contains custom parameters for the sensor.
parametersparameter_listOptionalA list of parameters to substitute into the source sensor.
preview_sensor_flagintOptionalSet to 1 to create or acquire a preview sensor.

Allowed values:0,1

queriessensor_query_listOptionalA list of sensor_query objects.
source_hashintOptionalThe hash of the sensor into which the parameters are substituted. If specified, source_id may be omitted.
source_idintOptionalThe id of the sensor into which the parameters are substituted. If specified, source_hash may be omitted.
source_namestringOptionalThe name of the source sensor. This field is used by the import and export routes when IDs change.
string_countlongOptional 
string_hintsstring_hint_listOptionalDefines initial strings to be hashed and added to the string cache for this sensor.
subcolumnssensor_subcolumn_listOptional 
namestringOptionalThe unique name of the sensor.
value_typestringOptionalSpecifies how the values are compared.
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are expected to be version strings, such as 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • BESDate: values are expected to be valid BES date strings
  • IPAddress: values are expected to be IP addresses
  • WMIDate: values are expected to be valid WMI date strings
  • TimeDiff: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of time, such as "2 years, 3 months, 18 days, 4 hours, 22 minutes, and 3.67 seconds" or "4.2 hours" (numeric + "Y|MO|W|D|H|M|S" units)
  • DataSize: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • NumericInteger: values are expected to be integer numeric values

Used by:

ObjectField
filtersensor
selectsensor
sensor_listsensor

examples.content:
{
   "category" : "Tanium",
   "content_set" : {
      "id" : 3,
      "name" : "Base"
   },
   "creation_time" : "2018-08-13T18:02:34Z",
   "delimiter" : ",",
   "description" : "The date and time on which the currently installed Tanium Client was installed on each client machine.
Example: Wed, 13 Nov 2013 08:18:00 -0480",
   "exclude_from_parse_flag" : true,
   "hash" : "3479253433",
   "hidden_flag" : false,
   "id" : 98,
   "ignore_case_flag" : true,
   "keep_duplicates_flag" : false,
   "last_modified_by" : "TaniumAdmin",
   "max_age_seconds" : 1800,
   "max_string_age_minutes" : 2880,
   "max_strings" : 100000,
   "mod_user" : {
      "display_name" : "",
      "domain" : "TAM",
      "id" : 1,
      "name" : "TaniumAdmin"
   },
   "modification_time" : "2018-08-13T18:02:34Z",
   "name" : "Tanium Client Installation Time",
   "parameter_definition" : "",
   "queries" : [
      {
         "platform" : "Windows",
         "script" : "'========================================
' Tanium Client Installation Time
'========================================
'@INCLUDE=utils/vbTimeToRFC822.vbs
'@INCLUDE=utils/settings/GetClientSetting.vbs

Option Explicit

Dim strFirstInstall, dInstallDateTime

strFirstInstall = GetClientSetting("FirstInstall", 0)

if IsNull(strFirstInstall) Then
	WScript.Echo "Not installed"
Else
	dInstallDateTime = Null
	On Error Resume Next
	dInstallDateTime = * ConvertToDate(strFirstInstall)
	On Error Goto 0
	
	If IsNull(dInstallDateTime) Then
		' this is just a fall back, in case someone put a 
		' bad value into the registry key, and all of the parsing
		' of the date failed, throwing an error
		dInstallDateTime = CDATE(strFirstInstall)
	End If
	
	WScript.Echo vbTimeToRFC822(dInstallDateTime, GetRFC822Bias())
End If

Function ConvertToDate(strDateAndTime) 
	Dim dResult, arrDateAndTime, arrDate, arrTime
	Dim * iDay, iMonth, iYear, iHour, iMinute

	arrDateAndTime = Split(strDateAndTime, " ")
	arrDate = Split(arrDateAndTime(0), "/")
	arrTime = Split(arrDateAndTime(1), ":")
	
	iDay = CInt(arrDate(0))
	iMonth = CInt(arrDate(1))
	iYear = CInt(arrDate(2))
	
	iHour = CInt(arrTime(0))
	iMinute = CInt(arrTime(1))
	
	dResult = DateSerial(iYear, iMonth, iDay) + TimeSerial(iHour, iMinute, 0)

	ConvertToDate = dResult
End Function ' ConvertToDate
'------------ INCLUDES * after this line. Do not edit past this point -----
'- Begin file: utils/vbTimeToRFC822.vbs
' Used to return a timestamp in an RFC822 compliant way
' Nice thing about this format is that it is sortable

' Usage can also include returning Date Only, Time Only, or All

' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/vbTimeToRFC822.vbs


Function vbTimeToRFC822(myDate, offset)
   
    Dim intOldLocale
    intOldLocale = GetLocale()
    SetLocale 1033 'Require month prefixes * to be us/english
    
    Dim myDay, myDays, myMonth, myYear
    Dim myHours, myMinutes, myMonths, mySeconds

    myDate = CDate(myDate)
    myDay = WeekdayName(Weekday(myDate),true)
    myDays = zeroPad(Day(myDate), 2)
    myMonth = MonthName(Month(myDate), true)
    myYear = Year(myDate)
    myHours = zeroPad(Hour(myDate), 2)
    myMinutes = zeroPad(Minute(myDate), 2)
    mySeconds = zeroPad(Second(myDate), 2)
    
    If IsNull(offset) Then
        offset = * GetRFC822Bias()
    End If

    vbTimeToRFC822 = myDay&", "& _
                                  myDays&" "& _
                                  myMonth&" "& _ 
                                  myYear&" "& _
                                  myHours&":"& _
                                  myMinutes&":"& _
                                  mySeconds&" "& _ 
                                  offset

    SetLocale intOldLocale ' Reset the locale back to before * function
End Function ' vbTimeToRFC822
'- End file: utils/vbTimeToRFC822.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/GetRFC822Bias.vbs
' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/GetRFC822Bias.vbs



Function GetRFC822Bias
    ' This function returns a string which is a
    ' timezone bias for RFC822 format
    ' considers daylight savings
    ' we choose 4 digits and a sign (+ or -)
    
    Dim objWMIService,colTimeZone,objTimeZone
    
    Dim * intTZBiasInMinutes,strSign,strReturnString
    
    Set objWMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:" _
        & "{impersonationLevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2")
    Set colTimeZone = objWMIService.ExecQuery("Select * from Win32_ComputerSystem")
    
    For Each objTimeZone in colTimeZone
        intTZBiasInMinutes = objTimeZone.CurrentTimeZone
    Next
    
    ' The offset is explicitly signed
    If intTZBiasInMinutes < 0 Then
        strSign = "-"
    * Else
        strSign = "+"
    End If
    
    strReturnString = CStr(Abs(intTZBiasInMinutes))
    ' no offset is greater than three digits but RFC822 bias seems to
    ' usually take the form of 1 alpha / 4 digit as described as
    ' valid in ANSI X3.51-1975
    
    strReturnString = zeroPad(strReturnString, 4)
    
    GetRFC822Bias = strSign & strReturnString
End Function ' GetRFC822Bias
'- End file: utils/GetRFC822Bias.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/zeroPad.vbs
' Pads * the string out to given length, with the character
' give on the right side

' To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/zeroPad.vbs


Function zeroPad(strToPad, intLen)
   zeroPad = String(intLen - Len(strToPad), "0") & strToPad
End Function ' zeroPad
'- End file: utils/zeroPad.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/settings/GetClientSetting.vbs
' Allows getting a client value from any version client

' To include this file, copy/paste: * INCLUDE=utils/settings/GetClientSetting.sh


Function GetClientSetting(strName, intLoc)
	' 0 = Base Setting, 1 = Status Setting
	Dim objSh, strPath, strResult
	Set objSh = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
	strResult = Null
	
	strPath = GetClientRegistryPath()
	
	If intLoc = 1 Then strPath = strPath & "\Status"
	
	strPath = strPath & "\" & strName
	
	On Error Resume Next
	strResult = objSh.RegRead(strPath)
	On Error Goto 0
	
	GetClientSetting = * strResult
End Function ' GetClientSetting

'- End file: utils/settings/GetClientSetting.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/settings/GetClientRegistryPath.vbs
' Returns a registry path value to the Tanium Clients registry area,
' regardless of the context in which the script is currently running.

' This method should only be used with objShell style retrievals - Not for use
' with RegistryProviders.  Use GetTaniumRegistryPathReg for use with registry providers
' To include this file, * copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/settings/GetClientRegistryPath.vbs


Function GetClientRegistryPath()
	Dim objSh, strResult
	Set objSh = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")

	On Error Resume Next
	strResult=Eval("objSh.RegRead(""HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\Path"")") : Err.Clear
	If strResult<>"" Then
		strResult="HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client"
	Else
		strResult=Eval("objSh.RegRead(""HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium * Client\Path"")") : Err.Clear
		
		If strResult<>"" Then
			strResult="HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
		End If
	End If
	On Error Goto 0
	
	If strResult="" Then Call fRaiseError(5, "GetClientRegistryPath", _
		"TSE-Error:Can not locate client registry area", False)

	GetClientRegistryPath = strResult
End Function
'- End file: utils/settings/GetClientRegistryPath.vbs
'- Begin file: utils/RaiseError.vbs
' To include this * file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/RaiseError.vbs

Function fRaiseError(errCode, errSource, errorMsg, RaiseError)
    If RaiseError Then
      On Error Resume Next
      Call Err.Raise(errCode, errSource, errorMsg)
      Exit Function
    Else
      WScript.Echo errorMsg
      Wscript.Quit
    End If
End Function
'- End file: utils/RaiseError.vbs",
         "script_type" : "VBScript"
      },
      {
         "platform" : "Linux",
         "script" : "#!/bin/sh
LANG=C

#@INCLUDE=utils/os/linux_package_manager.sh

#@START_INCLUDES_HERE
#------------ INCLUDES START - Do not edit between this line and INCLUDE ENDS -----
#- Begin file: utils/os/linux_package_manager.sh
# Used to return the type of package manager a Linux distribution uses

# To include this file, copy/paste: INCLUDE=utils/os/linux_package_manager.sh

linux_package_manager () {
        LINUX_TYPE=unknown
        if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ] || * [ -f /etc/centos-release ]; then
              if grep -qi 'CentOS.*' /etc/redhat-release; then
                 LINUX_TYPE=rpm
              elif grep -qi 'Red Hat.*' /etc/redhat-release; then
                 LINUX_TYPE=rpm
              fi
        fi
        if [ -f /etc/SuSE-release ]; then
              if grep -qi 'SUSE' /etc/SuSE-release; then
                 LINUX_TYPE=rpm
              fi
        fi
        if [ -f /usr/bin/lsb_release ]; then
           if * lsb_release -d | grep -qi 'CentOS.*'; then
                LINUX_TYPE=rpm
              elif lsb_release -d | grep -qi 'Red Hat.*'; then
                LINUX_TYPE=rpm
           elif lsb_release -d | grep -qi 'SUSE.*'; then
                LINUX_TYPE=rpm
           elif lsb_release -i | grep -qi 'Ubuntu'; then
                LINUX_TYPE=deb
           elif lsb_release -i | grep -qi 'Debian'; then
                LINUX_TYPE=deb
           fi
        fi
        echo * "$LINUX_TYPE"
}

#- End file: utils/os/linux_package_manager.sh
#------------ INCLUDES END - Do not edit above this line and INCLUDE STARTS -----

formatdate() {
   date -d "$1 $2 $3 $4 $5" +'%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S %z'
}

result=$(linux_package_manager)
if [ $result = 'rpm' ]; then
   rdate=$(rpm -qa --queryformat '%{installtime:date} %{name}\n' | grep anium | cut -d ' ' -f1-6)
   formatdate $rdate
elif [ $result = 'deb' ]; then
   rdate=$(stat * /var/lib/dpkg/info/taniumclient.postinst | grep Modify | cut -d ' ' -f2-6)
   formatdate $rdate
else
   echo "Unable to detect OS"
fi
",
         "script_type" : "UnixShell"
      },
      {
         "platform" : "Mac",
         "script" : "#!/bin/bash

formatdate() {
   date -jn "$2$3$4$1.$5" +'%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S %z'
}

rdate=$(mdls -name kMDItemFSCreationDate /Library/Tanium/TaniumClient | sed -e 's/-/ /g' -e 's/:/ /g' | cut -d ' ' -f3-8)
formatdate $rdate
",
         "script_type" : "UnixShell"
      },
      {
         "platform" : "Solaris",
         "script" : "#!/usr/xpg4/bin/sh

formatdate () {

mo=$1
dy=$2
yr=$3
hr=$4
mn=$5
tz=$(date +'%z')

if [ $mo = "Jan" ]; then
  dmo="01"
elif [ $mo = "Feb" ]; then
  dmo="02"
elif [ $mo = "Mar" ]; then
  dmo="03"
elif [ $mo = "Apr" ]; then
  dmo="04"
elif [ $mo = "May" ]; then
  dmo="05"
elif [ $mo = "Jun" ]; then
  dmo="06"
elif [ $mo = "Jul" ]; then
  dmo="07"
elif [ $mo = "Aug" ]; then
  dmo="08"
elif [ $mo = "Sep" ]; then
  * dmo="09"
elif [ $mo = "Oct" ]; then
  dmo="10"
elif [ $mo = "Nov" ]; then
  dmo="11"
elif [ $mo = "Dec" ]; then
  dmo="12"
fi

#http://www.linuxjournal.com/content/calculating-day-week
#There seems to be a bug around generating NRval/NFval values on 32/64 bit Solaris 10, added error handling.
#---
day=$dy
caldate="$dmo $yr"
expr="[^0-9]${day}[^0-9]"
cal $caldate | sed 's/^/ /;s/$/ /' > temp
NRval=$(cat temp | awk "/$expr/ { print NR }")
NFval=$(cat * temp | awk "/$expr/ { print NF }")
if [ $NRval ]; then
   if [ $NRval -eq 3 ] ; then
      DOW="$(( $day + ( 7 - $NFval ) ))"
   else
      DOW=$(cat temp | awk "/$expr/{ for (i=1;i<=NF;i++) { if (\$i~/${day}/) { print i }}}")
   fi
fi
/bin/rm -f temp
#---
rdow=$(echo $DOW | cut -d ' ' -f8)
if [ $rdow ]; then
   if [ $rdow = 1 ]; then
      dow="Sun"
   elif [ $rdow = 2 ]; then
      dow="Mon"
   elif [ $rdow = 3 ]; then
      dow="Tue"
   elif [ $rdow = * 4 ]; then
      dow="Wed"
   elif [ $rdow = 5 ]; then
      dow="Thu"
   elif [ $rdow = 6 ]; then
      dow="Fri"
   elif [ $rdow = 7 ]; then
      dow="Sat"
   fi
else
   dow=Unk
fi

if [ $dow = "Unk" ]; then
   echo $dy $mo $yr $hr:$mn $tz
else
   echo $dow, $dy $mo $yr $hr:$mn $tz
fi
}
rdate=$(pkginfo -l TaniumClient | grep INSTDATE | cut -d ' ' -f5-10 | sed 's/:/ /g')
formatdate $rdate
",
         "script_type" : "UnixShell"
      },
      {
         "platform" : "AIX",
         "script" : "#!/bin/sh
i=$(lslpp -hc TaniumClient | grep etc | awk -F: '{ print $7"#"$8 }' | sed 's/\;/:/g')
idate=$(echo "$i" | cut -d# -f1)
itime=$(echo "$i" | cut -d# -f2)

m=$(echo "$idate" | cut -d/ -f1)
d=$(echo "$idate" | cut -d/ -f2)
y=$(echo "$idate" | cut -d/ -f3)
tz=$(date +'%z')

case "$m" in
 1|01) MON=Jan ;;
 2|02) MON=Feb ;;
 3|03) MON=Mar ;;
 4|04) MON=Apr ;;
 5|05) MON=May ;;
 6|06) MON=Jun ;;
 7|07) MON=Jul ;;
 8|08) MON=Aug ;;
 9|09) * MON=Sep ;;
 10) MON=Oct ;;
 11) MON=Nov ;;
 12) MON=Dec ;;
esac

echo "$MON $d 20$y $itime $tz"
",

      }

title: Create plugin schedule
name: CreatePluginSchedule
description: Create a plugin schedule. A plugin schedule runs the specified plugin as the user that created the schedule.

Body parameters.description: (Required) The plugin_schedule object to create. The plugin_name and plugin_bundle fields are required.

Error 4xx.description: The input JSON must contain the plugin_name and plugin_bundle fields.
The input JSON must contain the plugin_name and plugin_bundle fields.

examples.title: Example request
examples.content:
$ curl -s -X POST --data-binary @new_plugin_schedule.json -H "session:{string}" https://localhost/api/v2/plugin_schedules
    # where new_plugin_schedule.json contains the following:
    # {
    #    "name" : "Sample Plugin Schedule",
    #    "plugin_name" : "trends-scheduleplugin",
    #    "plugin_bundle" : "products",
    #    "plugin_server" : "",
    #    "start_hour" : 1,
    #    "end_hour" : 3
    # }

title: Delete plugin schedule
name: DeletePluginSchedule
description: Delete the plugin schedule that matches the specified ID. Deleting a plugin schedule sets the deleted_flag field to true, but does not remove the object from the server. All users with the Administrator role can delete plugin schedules; no specific permission is required.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the plugin_schedule object to delete.

Success 200.description: The deleted plugin_schedule object. The deleted_flag field is set to true.

Error 4xx.description: No plugin_schedule object matches the specified ID.

title: Get plugins

The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Run plugin
name: RunPlugin
description: Run a specified plugin. Running a plugin through this request is synchronous and takes several minutes to complete.

Body parameters.description: (Required) The plugin to run. The name and bundle fields are required.

Error 4xx.description: The format of the input JSON is not valid or the JSON does not exist.
The input JSON must include the name and bundle fields.

examples.title: Example request

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Update plugin schedule by ID
name: UpdatePluginScheduleByID
description: Update the plugin schedule that matches the specified ID.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the plugin_schedule object to update.

Body parameters.description: A plugin_schedule object that contains the fields to update. Fields not included in the JSON are not updated. Any fields that you specify overwrite existing fields.

Error 4xx.description: No plugin_schedule object matches the specified ID.
The input JSON cannot include the id field. The ID is already included as a query parameter.

examples.title: Example request
examples.content:
$ curl -s -X PATCH --data-binary @updated_plugin_schedule.json -H "session:{string}" https://localhost/api/v2/plugin_schedules/2
    # where updated_plugin_schedule.json contains the following:
    # {
    #    "end_hour" : 4,
    #    "name" : "Updated Sample Plugin Schedule",
    #    "start_hour" : 2,
    # }

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Update plugin schedule by name
name: UpdatePluginScheduleByName
description: Update the plugin schedule that matches the specified name.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The name of the plugin_schedule object to update.

Body parameters.description: A plugin_schedule object that contains the fields to update. Fields not included in the JSON are not updated. Any fields that you specify overwrite existing fields.

Error 4xx.description: No plugin_schedule object matches the specified name. This message also displays when the input JSON contains the id field.
The input JSON cannot include the name field. The name is already included as a query parameter.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create question
name: CreateQuestion
description: Create a question on the Tanium Server. The question is immediately asked.

Body parameters.description: (Optional) The question object to create. To specify canonical text, the question object must ONLY include the query_text field. If you include other fields, the query_text field is ignored. If you do not specify a question object, or if the sensor does not exist, the question reverts to 'Get number of machines'.

Success 200.description: The ID of the new question object. You can use the ID to get question results from the Get question results by ID route.

Error 4xx.description: The sensor object specified in the input JSON does not exist.

examples.title: Example request
Example request (canonical text)
Example request (parameterized sensor)

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create saved question
name: CreateSavedQuestion
description: Create a saved question from an existing question. Use a saved question to issue the same question to the clients multiple times.

Body parameters.description: (Required) The saved_question object to create. The name and question fields are required.

Error 4xx.description: The input JSON must contain the name field.
Another saved question with the same name already exists. Select a different name or delete the existing saved question with the same name.
The input JSON must contain a question field with a valid question ID.
The input JSON must contain a question field with a valid question ID.

The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Delete saved question
name: DeleteSavedQuestion
description: Delete the saved question that matches the specified ID. Deleting a saved question sets the deleted_flag field to true, but does not remove the object from the server.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the saved_question object to delete.

Error 4xx.description: No saved_question object matches the specified ID.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Get merged result data for multiple questions
name: GetMergedResultData
description: Retrieve merged result data for multiple questions and saved questions using the ID of the specified questions and saved questions. There is no limit to the number of questions for which you can merge results.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The type of question. Valid values are question and saved_question. Each object must be proceeded by the ID of the object, such as question/19.
(Required) The ID of the question or saved_question object that preceeds the ID.

Success 200.description: A ResultXML object that contains merged result data.

Error 4xx.description: No saved_question object matches the specified ID.
No question object matches the specified ID.
The request must include at least one question or saved_question object.
The result data for the questions cannot be merged.

                     {
                        "platform" : "Windows",
                        "script" : "'========================================
' Tanium Client Action Folder Sizes
'========================================

Option Explicit

SetLocale(GetTaniumLocale)

Const HKLM = &H80000002
Dim objRegistry,strTaniumClientKey
Dim objFSO,objFolder,strTaniumClientPath,strDownloadsDir
Dim lngSize,intCount,folder
Dim strSize,strSep

strSep = "|"

Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")

Set * objRegistry=GetObject("winmgmts:\\.\root\default:StdRegProv")

strTaniumClientKey = GetTaniumRegistryPath()
If Not strTaniumClientKey = "" Then
	objRegistry.GetStringValue HKLM,strTaniumClientKey,"Path",strTaniumClientPath
End If

If ( IsNull(strTaniumClientPath) Or strTaniumClientPath = "") Or ( Not objFSO.FolderExists(strTaniumClientPath)) Then
	WScript.Echo "Tanium Client Directory Not Found"
Else
	On Error Resume Next
	strDownloadsDir = * strTaniumClientPath&"\Downloads"
	lngSize = 0
	intCount = 0
	If objFso.FolderExists(strDownloadsDir) Then
		Set objFolder = objFso.GetFolder(strDownloadsDir)

		For Each folder In objFolder.SubFolders
			If Left(folder.Name, 7) = "Action_" Then
				lngSize = lngSize + GetAccessibleFolderSize(folder.Path)
				intCount = intCount + 1
			End If
		Next
		On Error Goto 0
		If intCount > 0 Then
			WScript.Echo * GetPrettyFileSize(CStr(lngSize))
		Else
			WScript.Echo "No Action Folders Found in Downloads dir"
		End If
	
	Else
		WScript.Echo "Tanium Client Downloads Directory Not Found"
	End If


End If

' --- end main --- '

Function RegKeyExists(objRegistry, sHive, sRegKey)
	Dim aValueNames, aValueTypes
	If objRegistry.EnumValues(sHive, sRegKey, aValueNames, aValueTypes) = 0 Then
		RegKeyExists = True
	Else
		RegKeyExists = False
	End * If
End Function
	
Function GetTaniumRegistryPath
'GetTaniumRegistryPath works in x64 or x32
'looks for a valid Path value

    Dim objShell
    Dim keyNativePath, keyWoWPath, strPath, strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
      
    Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
    
    keyNativePath = "Software\Tanium\Tanium Client"
    keyWoWPath = "Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client"
    
    ' first check the Software key (valid for 32-bit * machines, or 64-bit machines in 32-bit mode)
    On Error Resume Next
    strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyNativePath&"\Path")
    On Error Goto 0
    strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = keyNativePath
 
    If strPath = "" Then
        ' Could not find 32-bit mode path, checking Wow6432Node
        On Error Resume Next
        strPath = objShell.RegRead("HKLM\"&keyWoWPath&"\Path")
        On Error Goto 0
        strFoundTaniumRegistryPath = * keyWoWPath
    End If
    
    If Not strPath = "" Then
        GetTaniumRegistryPath = strFoundTaniumRegistryPath
    Else
        GetTaniumRegistryPath = False
        WScript.Echo "Error: Cannot locate Tanium Registry Path"
    End If
End Function 'GetTaniumRegistryPath

Function GetPrettyFileSize(strSize)
Dim dblSize
	dblSize = CDbl(strSize)

	If dblSize > 1024*1024*1024 Then ''Should be GB
		strSize = CStr(Round(dblSize / 1024 / 1024 / 1024, * 1)) & " GB"	
	ElseIf dblsize > 1024*1024 Then  ''Should be MB
		strSize = CStr(Round(dblSize / 1024 / 1024, 1)) & " MB"
	ElseIf dblSize > 1024 Then  ''Should be kB
		strSize = CStr(Round(dblSize / 1024)) & " KB"
	Else
		strSize = CStr(dblSize) & " B"	
	End If	
	GetPrettyFileSize = strSize
End Function 'GetPrettyFileSize


Function GetAccessibleFolderSize(strFolderPath)
' Gets the folder sizes that it is able to
' and skips those it has * no rights to see
    On Error Resume Next ' Permissions Errors potentially

	Dim objFSO
    Dim objFolder,objSubfolder,intSize,bHasSubfolders	
	Set objFSO = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject")
	    
    bHasSubfolders = False

    Set objFolder = objFSO.GetFolder(strFolderPath)
    Err.Clear
    intSize = objFolder.Size
    If Err.Number <> 0 Then
        For Each objSubfolder in objFolder.SubFolders
            intSize = intSize + * GetAccessibleFolderSize(objSubfolder.Path)
            bHasSubfolders = True
        Next

        If Not bHasSubfolders Then
            intSize = objFolder.Size
        End If
    End If

    GetAccessibleFolderSize = intSize
    
    On Error Goto 0

End Function 'GetAccessibleFolderSize

Function GetTaniumLocale
'' This function will retrieve the locale value
' previously set which governs Tanium content that
' is locale sensitive.

	Dim * objWshShell
	Dim intLocaleID
	
	Set objWshShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell")
	On Error Resume Next
	intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID")
	If Err.Number <> 0 Then
		intLocaleID = objWshShell.RegRead("HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Tanium\Tanium Client\LocaleID")
	End If
	On Error Goto 0
	If intLocaleID = "" Then
		GetTaniumLocale = 1033 ' default to us/English
	Else
		GetTaniumLocale = * intLocaleID
	End If

	' Cleanup
	Set objWshShell = Nothing

End Function 'GetTaniumLocale",

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create server throttle
name: CreateServerThrottle
description:
Create a server throttle. A server throttle controls the rate at which data is sent across all client connections. For example, use a server throttle to enforce "The server should never use more than 1 Mbps sending sensors to clients".

Only one server throttle can be active on a server. The server uses the server_throttle object with the lowest ID field and no value in the ip_address field.

Body parameters.description: (Optional) The server_throttle object to create. If you specify a value for the ip_address field, the server will create the object but will not make it active.

examples.title: Example request
examples.content:
$ curl -s -X POST --data-binary @new_server_throttle.json -H "session:{string}" https://localhost/api/v2/server_throttles
    # where new_server_throttle.json contains the following:
    # {
    #    "bandwidth_bytes_limit" : 1000000,
    #    "connection_limit" : 10,
    #    "download_bandwidth_bytes_limit" : 1000000,
    #    "download_connection_limit" : 10,
    #    "name" : "Sample Server Throttle",
    #    "sensor_bandwidth_bytes_limit" : 1000000,
    #    "sensor_connection_limit" : 10
    # }

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Create site throttle
name: CreateSiteThrottle
description:
Create a site throttle. A site throttle controls the rate at which data is sent to a list of subnets. For example, use a site throttle to enforce "The server should never send more than 5 Mbps to 192.168.0.0/16".

If you create multiple site throttles for the same connection, all throttles will be applied to the connection, and the server will try not to exceed the rate on any of the applied throttles.

Body parameters.description: (Optional) The site_throttle object to create.

The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Get whitelisted URLs
name: GetWhitelistedURLs
description: Retrieve all whitelisted URL definitions on the server.

Success 200.description: The white_listed_url_list object contains an array of all white_listed_url objects on the server. If there are no white_listed_url objects, returns an empty array.

Header parameters.description: (Required) The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the Log in and Validate routes. The token string is returned by the Create API token route. For examples of both sessions strings and token strings, see the example requests in the Create API token route.

title: Update whitelisted URL by ID
name: UpdateWhitelistedURLByID
description: Update the whitelisted URL that matches the specified ID.

Path parameters.description: (Required) The ID of the white_listed_url object to update.

Body parameters.description: A white_listed_url object that contains the fields to update. Fields not included in the JSON are not updated. Any fields that you specify overwrite existing fields.

Error 4xx.description: No white_listed_url object matches the specified ID.
The input JSON cannot include the id field. The ID is already included as a query parameter.
